Reviews.Title: “A solid choice for any situation”
Reviews.Author: squished18
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our 1-year old, stayed for two nights. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. The service was excellent. All the staff were friendly and helpful. We complained that the first room we were given was too noisy and they accommodated us, even though they were tight on rooms. We wanted to take the shuttle but found that it is limited in where it goes. It wouldn't go to Granville Island, which is just across the river. However, it is within walking distance of transit. The rooms are a little small, but I suppose space in downtown Vancouver is pretty pricey. There is a coin laundry, which is handy for those longer trips. The White Spot restaurant on-site is very reasonable for prices and has a full menu. You can get take-out and eat in your room, if that's your style. Overall a very good family hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Dwight_At_PikePlace
Reviews.Content: Was mega-pleased with this hotel! Located quite centrally in downtown, close to the waterwalk way, very close to transportation, and the aquabus service! Easy access to entertainment area. Good service, but area becomes pretty busy during the weekend nights!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable & Efficient”
Reviews.Author: patersonKelowna
Reviews.Content: Great stay in this hotel. Parking is easy and accessible with locked gate. The corner room that we had was terrific with 2 sides being largely comprised of windows so lots of natural lighting. Very clean and beds comfortable. The bedroom and bathroom are not large but we found all space has been very efficiently used. I loved that they had a kettle for tea (not just the standard coffee pot) and that they provide a jug so you can get filtered water from the water cooler system that they have on every floor. Nice touch! Hotel staff were all very pleasant and friendly. We did find the 2 elevators a bit slow, especially at max busy times. They do have a larger gap under the bedroom entrance door so noise and light travels from the hallway. I had to put a pillow along the bottom of the door so the light didn't flow into the room so much. Mayb they could put door sweeps in place which would help eliminate some of the problem. They have White Spot on site providing easy access and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: staycation79
Reviews.Content: We chose the Best Western downtown after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. We found the room clean, the grouting in the toilet was spotless. Friendly service from the Front Desk staff to the cleaning staff. We rented a car and it's the first turning coming over the Granville bridge, so it's really easy to remember the directions and get to other parts of Vancouver. Because of it's location, you avoid much of the downtown traffic too. Parking fees are reasonable. Bed is comfortable with sufficent pillows. Security is quite high, a key card is required to access the lift and even the parking garage. There are hair dryers in each room. The lcd tv is modern and has lots of channels. And there is a jug for drinking water in each room. And a water dispenser on our floor. It was like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: Bolduc54
Reviews.Content: Stayed early October 2011. Close to some very good restaurants and bus routes. Took bus to Sky Train then Sky Train to airport. Rooms may be small but who cares if you're just sleeping there. Very clean. Breakfast included. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: dumu
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this hotel on a family vacation in Vancouver. Downtown Vancouver is quite accessible from this location. We took advantage of a complimentary shuttle service to drop us off anywhere we wanted to go in downtown Vancouver and we also used the "free bikes" they have available for use. The White Spot restaurant, on the ground floor of the hotel offers a 15% food discount to hotel guests. The staff were very helpful and made several good suggestions regarding both things to do in Vancouver as well as places to go to eat. There's a Tim Horton's about one block away which was a convenient walk for breakfast. A very good restaurant just a few blocks north on Granville is "Samafir"...tapas restaurant - the food is excellent. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodation for Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: Moneychanger
Reviews.Content: While not located in the most premium part of Vancouver, we regularly use this hotel for our Vancouver visits. Rooms are clean, well equipped, has complimentary WIFI, coffee and tea. Excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great value.”
Reviews.Author: C_mak115
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the Granville St. entertainment area, especially if you are attending a show or out clubbing. The rooms are clean but small and very basic. There are better deals out there for nicer rooms. The cost for parking is a good value compared to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “our second stay and we'll return in the future”
Reviews.Author: Tammy_and_Brent
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this hotel. The first time was in May 2010 for one night. We had originally picked this hotel based on reviews on trip advisor and we were not disappointed. We stayed 4 nights this time and just returned home. It's Feb and they had a great price for downtown Vancouver ($72/night CAD + tax). When you book online, I like that when you Select a Rate Plan and keep the default "Show Rates", that you get results under several rate plans (such as AAA, Senior, Internet Only Rate, etc). My only tip is that since they don't list the prices under every single rate plan they have, is to go through all the options at the beginning of the reservation process. We booked under the 30 Day Advance Purchase plan this time and saved a good chunk of change compared to the Best Available Rate. We were once again upgraded to a room with a king room - very nice. We had booked a room with one queen bed. We used their complimentary bike service this time. They provided a lock and a helmet for each bike. The shuttle service is nice, though you need to book ahead. We had used it last time. There is parking for a fee, either $13 or $14 per day. If you have lunch or dinner at White Spot, let them know you are staying at the hotel and you'll get 15% off your bill. Yaletown Roundhouse Sky train station is the nearest station to the hotel. It's around a 10 min walk between the two and is slightly uphill from the station to the hotel. There is construction next door, currently a big hole. Our room looked over it. They seemed to start work around 8am in the morning on weekdays, but so far the noise isn't too bad. We have family in the city and we'll be back to Vancouver for visits in the future. We will definitely check out this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “One of best!”
Reviews.Author: KJLAROSE
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vancouver once or twice a year and this is the hotel I prefer to stay at . Clean, comfortable, secure, affordable, and an excellent location. There is excellent staff in every department and the restaurant has excellent affordable food. Nice rooftop area with a gym, hot tub, and an outside deck with a nice view.. I really like that the hotel is within 5 blocks of the new rapid transit train making travel to and from the airport and anywhere else very easy. Bus stop also right next to the building. Don't let the construction all around the hotel stop you from visiting, the rooms have heavy glass windows that block the noise very well. My room was facing one construction site and it did not bother me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Berkeley604
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night before heading to Whistler when we had friends visiting from SF. This hotel is a great value and well-located near the Granville bridge (for quick exit out of downtown) and entertainment district. Its underground parking lot was convenient and secure. Its staff were very helpful and courteous. We knew that there was construction nearby and were worried that it might be noisy. However, we never noticed (our room was facing the taxi parking lot), nor did the bridge traffic. The hotel also has a downtown shuttle, but we didn't make use of it since we had a car.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very nice property.”
Reviews.Author: aspen5
Reviews.Content: Really - from top to bottom, excellent property - rooms are modern, clean, very comfortable. Location is pretty good for getting anywhere on Granville Island easily. Only issue: major construction going on to the east and west of the hotel. We were greeted promptly at 7:30 AM by a couple of backhoes and dump trucks outside our window. I will say this BW is quieter and cleaner than the Chateau Granville a couple of blocks down the road and the construction is likely not going on at night or on weekends. The CG has single pane windows that do not keep out much noise. All-in-all, if you're looking for a great, inexpensive place to stay a few nights, I would highly recommend this location.

Reviews.Title: “Still A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: menelson2001
Reviews.Content: In 2003 we stayed at this BW in the Penthouse suite, I put a review on trip advisor at that time. We came back this year and stayed in the same suite. It is still very good. Clean, Great views, very nice staff. It is a huge unit that a family of 4 has comfortably spent 3 nights in. there is a full size dining table and jacuzzi tub, plus plenty of room for two roll away beds. It has a complete Kitchen- mini fridge, cook top, microwave, sink, plus all needed dishes and equipment for 4 people. Amenities. Hot Tub Great exercise room, better equipped than other hotels I have stayed at. Ping pong table. Free bikes to borrow and a list of trails. We are here in the winter and did not take advantage of that but for summer travelers it might be nice to know about. There is also a restaurant on site now- White Spot. It was just mediocre. We had dinner there the first night and made other arrangements after that. The reasons I did not mark it excellent: the Sofa needs replacing. we used the sofa bed for one of our kids the first night- and had to get a rollaway bed for the remainder of our stay, as the sofa is really uncomfortable- even as a sofa. the parking is no longer free. it is an additional 15.00 per night. Finally, in a suite with a kitchen I would expect some sort of paper towels or napkins- other than those minor things- it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: GlobalGirl98
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times before and have always found a good deal on Hotels.ca. The check-in is always great, hotel is very secure, rooms are always clean and so quiet. This is one of my favorite stays in Vancouver. I only had one issue this time which was parking. Hotels.ca listed parking as $10/night, but on check-in they said it was $18.99/night. I had to show them the website to prove it should be $10/night which they honored. So make sure you know your details if you book on expedia, hotels.ca or hotwire. Other than that, it was problem-free and a great stay. Everything is within walking distance and super close to the bus stop that takes you to Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: GregS99
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was great, close to downtown, English Bay and Stanley Park. Rooms were tidy & clean employees courteous and had a White Spot as the restaurant. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: TraveljohnsonJ
Reviews.Content: This is not the kind of hotel you would normally expect from Best Western and that is why it has a "Plus" designation. A couple of years ago Best Western began to give additional designations to its single brand name and this has improved my perception of Best Western. After all, not all Best Westerns are created equal. This hotel is a great example of quality, service and value to the traveling public. I found this location to be very central-steps to the ferry to Granville Island, within the entertainment district and adjacent to Yaletown. I found the front desk personnel most pleasant and helpful. My request for a wakeup call and an early morning taxi were faultless. The quality of the room product was amenity rich, perhaps too much so. It had a stack with a refrigerator topped with a microwave topped with a coffee maker. All the table lamps had power outlets so you never have to move furniture to find an outlet to recharge your phone or computer. My bathroom had big fluffy towels and all the soaps and toiletries one might need. Most unusual was my bathroom had a window with a great view of downtown Vancouver! My only not-so-negative comments would be the style of the furnishings does not live up to the quality potential this hotel has; and, the water pressure in the shower was not constant. Would I return to this hotel? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Another good Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: TravelObession
Reviews.Content: After all ready staying at another hotel at the start of our trip, we wanted a different location on return for the last few days, so we could do other activities & also experience a different area of town. We arrived here at 11pm, but hotel was aware of this. Check in was nice & easy. Was also told about the free shuttle they offer during certain hours to drop you off downtown. Room - was nice, clean & good views. Having stayed at a few hotels all ready, this one was the smallest, but it wasn't crapped by any means. The decor was modern. Very comfortable bed, which is my number one concern. Had a fridge, microwave, coffee maker (bonus points was that they also had decaf coffee filters!). The bathroom was also tidy & clean. Liked that it had a pull out face mirror with light - great for doing makeup in Negative Point - hall way noise. My friend was woken at appx 4am to a number of people talking & laughing in the hall way. We understand people go out & do make some noise on return, but she said it was close on an hour before it stopped. So noise does carry in the rooms. Hotel - Was very close to Granville Island. Also bus stop right out the front - we mainly used buses while in Vancouver as the public system was really easy to use (both day & night). Also we did make use of the free shuttle both days we where there, but make sure you advise them early if you need it, as it can be out all ready. Has free internet in the foyer to use, which was great. Staff where help to help when we asked questions. Also where happy to store our bags on the last day as we where not going until that night. There was also a White Spot Resturant attached to the hotel, which was great - we had breakfast & lunch here. There's also a 7 Eleven across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Reasonably Quiet”
Reviews.Author: DRS123
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were friendly and acknowledged you each time you went past. My room, although not large compared to others I have stayed in, was clean and the bed was comfortable. I was on the 9th floor with a room on the corner of the building however the street noise was acceptable for a city hotel. There is a large building being constructed opposite however noise from the site was limited to daylight hours so I would not let this work put you off staying here. The rates were good and included an allowance (by voucher) for breakfast. The selection of food for breakfast and dinner was limited but was hot and well presented. There is a complimentary shuttle service to wherever you need to go in the downtown area. This service is one-way only so you need to make your own way back. It can be a long walk back from some places but the walk back through the main city area passes lots of shops, bars and restaurants so you can take your time if you want. There is also plenty of public transport or taxis. A 7-Eleven store is located across the street and is handy for a range of things such as a snack, magazine or a tube of toothepaste. There is a hotel opposite which is a venue for live music on some nights however I did not hear any when in my room. I wouldn't recommend it for a quiet drink at the end of a long day. I would stick to the bar in the Best Western for that. The staff in this bar were also very friendly and spent time to have a chat. Based on my experience I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Best Western hotels”
Reviews.Author: GeoffO869
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the generally good reviews on Tripadvisor - and it didn't disappoint. We needed somewhere for one night after disembarking a cruise ship and before flying to Los Angeles the following day. The hotel is fairly well located for both the public transport system - including the new airlink to YVR - and indeed all of what central Vancouver has to offer. Our taxi driver had us there in around 10 minutes - he also mentioned that he'd heard good things about it from other guests too so that bode well for our stay. The building is fairly modern and well presented and that theme continues once inside. The reception team could not have been friendlier or more helpful - quickly welcoming us labelling and then storing our cases and providing both a map and detailed advice about what was where and how much it cost. That enabled us to have an enjoyable day wandering around - we probably covered around 8 miles on foot and took in most of both the downtown and harbour areas. However it must also be said that some of Vancouver is actually best left unseen. There are some very seedy parts indeed - including those around Chinatown - and it is clear that drugs play a major role in this. Returning to the hotel by a different route took us through what was obviously a predominantly gay area - but this was very colourful and certainly not threatening in the way some other parts of the city had been. Having been reunited with our cases we were quickly in the bedroom which was quite large well equipped and functional - although perhaps the lighting could have been a little better. Although the hotel is surrounded by bars and restaurants of all sorts we chose to stay and eat in the restaurant accessed by the side of reception. The service and food was very good indeed - and also offered great value for money considering it was to all intents and purposes part of the hotel. After a very comfortable night - there is some adjacent building work going on but it certainly didn't disturb us - we checked out quite early and therefore didn't have time for breakfast. Once again the whole team at reception were extremely warm and personable - and in a really genuine sort of way which makes all the difference. Would we stay again - definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver 2011”
Reviews.Author: 84Carolyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights and had no complaints with the hotel at all. Everywhere was clean and the staff very helpful. The complimemtary shuttle was great and the drivers gave us good advice. My only complaint was that it was at the rather seedy end of Granville Street- but having said that we were close to Granville Island and after getting the shuttle in the morning always walked back to the hotel in the evening. The White Spot restaurant located next door was very good and we used this most days.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay. wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: pam6
Reviews.Content: Spent four days at this hotel ( 24rth - 27th) Extremely happy. would definately stay here again. when we arrived my partner needed a dentist urgently. Carina on front desk was fantastic and spent a lot of time trying to find us a dentist after hours. The room was very clean and well appointed. Only wish we had arranged to spend more time here. Beds very comfortable and the transport to the city was a bonus. Hotel not situated in the best part of Vancouver but this was not a problem to us at all. we tried the restaurant on site and this was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: martin l
Reviews.Content: My friends and I can highly recommend this hotel (we had 2 rooms on the 10th floor). In its price range I have never encountered better service or cleaner, more appealing accomodations. The front desk was extremely helpful and courteous. The room cleaning was flawless. The beds were very comfortable and just perhaps one step below the dream beds at a Westin. Only one thing to criticize: The rooms are listed as including a full breakfast (up to $10 in value in the White Spot next door); one of our rooms was at the senior rate (which was supposedly "discounted" $10) and the other was at the normal rate (no discount). The senior rated room turned out not to include breakfast, meaning the "discount" for seniors is really not a discount after all; the seniors just get less! Otherwise, there were no complaints and the hotel is definitely to be commended.

Reviews.Title: “Great value but.....”
Reviews.Author: eileenwallace1958
Reviews.Content: The B & B special is a great value as you get underground parking, breakfast at White Spot and the hotel room for a very low price. The hotel is very clean, has free internet in rooms and lobby and staff is very helpful. There is currently a new building being built next door that is just started, so ask for a higher floor to lessen the noise. The building is close to the Grenville Bridge but the area at times was somewhat seedy with transient people close by in the evenings. Has guest laundry room, gym, saunas and hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Fell Short”
Reviews.Author: mom22Saskatchewan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. Check in was slow and painful. On the first evening, complained that the air conditioning wasn't working and finally on the last night they offered to move us to a different room. The hot tub was also not available the one night my husband and children wanted to use it. The shuttle was first book first use and you could not book it a day in advance. You had to call the same day at 7am. We called at 7:01am and it was already booked so we were SOL. Rooms are super small, but clean. Staff tried to be friendly, but really not that helpful. We were quite disappointed in this hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “The Breath of Fresh Air!”
Reviews.Author: JoPeSh3
Reviews.Content: This Best Western is the FINEST Best Western I have ever stayed at! When you walk into the lobby, you receive the heavenly sent of White Tea and Thyme air Fragrance! Simply Heavenly! The Staff at the front desk are the most friendliest around! The Room for your basic necessity is clean, fresh, and appealing. The beds are VERY comfortable to sleep in! When coming back to Vancouver, B.C. I will definitely plan a visit to stay at this Best Western!

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Plus Vancouver downtown”
Reviews.Author: rphmom57
Reviews.Content: stayed at the BW in downtown Vancouver for 2 nites. Friendly staff, clean rooms and excellent location. Wi fi great and free . Recommened this Best Western for short stay in Vancouver Downtown. Parking garage available for additional cost but car was safe.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs Oct.3,2011”
Reviews.Author: DesignGurl
Reviews.Content: Bought this room on Priceline. My son had a concert in Vancouver Monday night.. and it was too late to be able to get any transit home (I live 70 mins outside of the city). I decided to get a room at Best Western Plus Downtown Vancouver because I was so tired and didn't want to drive home late. $140/night. 3am He wakes me to tell me that he thinks they have bed bugs and I ask, did he see them? he says 'no, but look' ...and he has 4 welts across his chest.. (he is allergic to them.. he had two other occurrences, at a hotel a year ago and another time with friends of his that had got a couch off Craigslist that was infested. After seeing the doctor did research on what they look like, etc) so.. he takes all the pillowcases off, etc.. and while we are packing up.. (our bags were never placed on the beds) we find a bug crawling across the white blanket and I took a picture of it. Then he squished it. We drove home at 3:45am even though I was so exhausted. They are telling me that they had the room checked out, and don't have bedbugs.. but perhaps I was the one that brought them in with me. (LOL!!!!) I said, with my son's instant reaction to the bites, we would have known if we had them beforehand. He was only in that bed for 3 hours. According to the head office, the manager would like the chance to talk to me again and 'help me to decipher where the bites came from because they did not happen at their hotel'. So... the bites, and the picture of the bug in the hotel are a figment of my imagination apparently. How's that for awesome customer service??

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Plus Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: pammy071
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three weeks here & it was excellent. There is a free shuttle for outbound journeys (I can recommend going to Stanley Park) & also free internet access. We had a room with a small area for cooking. It was equipped with a microwave, kettle, 2 hobs, and a toaster. Basic cooking utensils & crockery was also provided. The White Spot restaurant was good. Our room was large & the beds were very comfortable. All the staff were friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Can walk to Yaletown”
Reviews.Author: Aprilp2412
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean. The staff was very helpful and the hotel has free internet and wi-fi. You can walk to Yaletown in just a few minutes and can walk over the bridge to Granville Island in about 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Short but sweet stay!”
Reviews.Author: twangypearl
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Vancouver so usually I stay with friends. However on a stopover on business and wanted the convenience of a hotel. Free in room wifi (that actually worked well) was definite bonus. Compact, clean, comfy room. Very good service at the front desk, and overheard a lot of helpful advice for tourists. Close walk to Yaletown restaurants and a hop skip and a jump to the ferry to Granville Island. Also they offer a shuttle to the heart of downtown shopping and coupons to some local attractions. I would recommend this hotel to business and tourist visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Looks are deceiving!”
Reviews.Author: Barbra_M
Reviews.Content: A city location that belies its location: a short walk to False Creek and the Aquabus to Granville Island plus a free shuttle to Canada Centre. Great restaurant in-house for breakfast or any other meal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: apache511
Reviews.Content: The location is within walking distance to downtown, Sunset Beach, Ferries, Granville Island, and Stanley Park. Staff is friendly and they offer free usage of bicycles for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Fits the bill”
Reviews.Author: sudders08
Reviews.Content: There's more than one Best Western in downtown Vancouver. This one is in a good location though. There's a 7-11 across the corner and it's an easy walk into the shopping and entertainment districts. It's also a 5 minute walk from ferries to Granville Island. Probably the best thing about the hotel is the friendliness of the staff - constant smiles and cheery greetings all the while still being professional and helpful. It does make a difference to a weary traveller. The facilities are decent too. The rooms are reasonably spacious and comfortable. You wouldn't confuse it with luxury though. The hotel provides free wifi for internet access. The attached White Spot restaurant provides the meals and is decent fare. Again, you wouldn't confuse it with Michelin-star dining but is more than edible. I'd certainly stay here again and would recommend it to fellow travellers.

Reviews.Title: “A few hiccups, but we'll be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: LMSINF
Reviews.Content: I run a community program for adults with Developmental and Physical Disabilities, and part of that program is a travel club. Our first trip was to spend a week in Vancouver. We chose this hotel for several reasons. 1, the location is awesome...we went all over the city and were literally 15 minutes or less from everything. Very easy to hop on any form of transit, or even walk. 2, the cost was great. we paid $179 a night, and for being right down town that's pretty amazing. 3, we were told it was a fully wheelchair accessible hotel, including having shower stalls rather than tubs in some rooms where the wheelchair can roll right in and out with no transfers needed. This was a huge thing for us as we had two individuals that required this. 4, adjoining rooms were available, with two queens in each room, which was also very important to us. 5, there was a restaurant attached to the hotel which made getting the group up and meeting for breakfast was very easy and convenient. My travel agent and I spoke directly with one of the managers of the hotel, arranged extremely specific room requirements and assignments, paid in full and were very happy with the process. When we arrived to the hotel it ended up being not quite what we expected. 1. There are no wheelchair accessible showers. Yes, the bathrooms are bigger so that a wheelchair could be in it, if it fit through the door, but you would need to do a full transfer in to the tub. 2. The only adjoining room possibilities are one king, and two doubles. 3, most of the room assignements were incorrect. It took about 3 hours to get it all sorted out and everyone where they were comfortable. There were 14 of us in total, so it was a large group milling around trying to get organized. The people that were working upon our arrival were absolutely amazing at doing everything they could to make us comfortable. they moved rooms around and rearranged and made the adjoining rooms work for us. Then in the room that absolutely needed the wheelchair accessible shower, they were able to provide a bath chair that was fully adjustable. We had to make a few changes, and it took two assistants to do the bath rather than one, but they did what they could. Upon finding out that the beds were too high for the person in the wheelchair to get on,they quickly removed the boxspring to lower it, and stayed almost 2 hours with that family making sure they were completely comfortable with everything. They checked on us at least twice a day, and also gave us vouchers which allowed all of us to have a free breakfast at the adjoining restaurant. Though we were mislead by the person we spoke to, and it wasn't overly pleasant checking in, all of the staff were awesome - very friendly, helpful and warm. The hotel was clean and welcoming and comfortable and we had a great time! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone - they will make sure you are comfortable and happy any way that they can! They also have a lovely little patio on the 11th floor with an open view of vancuover, guest laundry facilities, a gym and a jacuzzi and sauna - awesome!

Reviews.Title: “First visit to Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Willie'sMom
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay for our first trip to Vancouver. It was convenient to everything we wanted to see. It was also convenient place for the tour companies to pick us up from. They have a great little restaurant - The White Spot that we really enjoyed. The room was comfortable and we had a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jill-Jack
Reviews.Content: The welcome at this hotel was superb and was followed up be a room call to ensure all was as it should be - a welcome touch and most appreciated!! We were upgraded which again was a wonderful touch and our large room was lovely, clean with lots of fluffy towels and very nice toiletries. Very quiet room even though we were on a corner with two roads! Fitness suite and jacuzzi wonderful; added bonus of table tennis for 60 year old friends to have fun - great!!! Food at the adjoining restaurant excellent with discount for hotel guests. Very central to all that's going on; very safe walking about (even at night). The outside area at the top of the hotel was another bonus and enjoyed drinks at sunset looking out over the city. Thank you to all the staff!

Reviews.Title: “get the date night package”
Reviews.Author: k-rizzzle
Reviews.Content: We booked the date night package and it was well worth it, we got the penthouse room with a bottle of wine, a gift card for $50 to any downtown restaurant and breakfast for 2 for $249. The room was spacious and well kept with a dining area,mini kitchen,living room and a master king room with jacuzzi. It was our first time staying here and I wasn't sure what to expect, I was pleasantly suprised the staff were very friendly and attentive- they even phoned up to our room to see if we needed anything. This hotel is walking distance to any downtown activity and we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “MUCH BEYOND OUR EXPECTATIONS”
Reviews.Author: SUNIL S
Reviews.Content: Franky did not expect more than basic services.The Front Office staff were very friendly and went out of their way to help.As tourists from India we were quite lost in a new city -- thats where they were most useful and friendly with info/directions/opinions etc. The rooms very comfortable and clean and the microwave was a bonus.The hotel has a well maintained and well lit look which was pleasant.On two occasions we needed help with heavy bags and when the porter was not available, the F.O staff personally brought the bags to our room ! Net,net : highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sydney72
Reviews.Content: Nice big room, very clean. Pleasant staff. Appreciated the free shuttle bus and the 15 minutes free internet use. Good breakfast in White Spot restaurant. Only bad thing was the noise from the hotel across the street on Grandville which kept me awake till 2:30 am every night. We had a corner room on Drake/Grandville.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: traveller55
Reviews.Content: This hotel grew on me. We arrived after 20 hours travelling to find that the agents (not the hotel) had messed up our booking so that rather than the room with 2 beds that we'd requested we were shown to a quite small double. However the hotel were happy to move us to one with 2 queen beds, as well as a fridge, microwave and coffee maker, this was much more comfortable for a 7 night stay. I liked the facilities - the laundry room was really useful with 2 washers and 2 dryers. We used the penthouse gym (with the adjacent roof terrace) every day and although we didn't borrow bikes they were available to use for free. We loved the White Spot restaurant and went there for breakfast and dinner. Although it's not the hotel restaurant it may as well be as it's attached and opens into the hotel lobby. The free shuttle bus is 'on demand' and will take you to wherever you want to go downtown - so we had arranged a transfer to our cruise ship (for the next week) but other passengers were just using the shuttle. The area is a little run down but I never felt uncomfortable or worried and within 2 minutes walk it becomes much more swish. We loved Vancouver. I'm sure there are better hotels, but they'll come at a price and this was more than adequate for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Osoyoos-traveller
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel, and although the hotel itself deserved a high rating, the area it is located in is at the edge of the downtown core, in what could best be described as a depressed area, and a good 15 minute walk to the actual downtown shopping area through almost a slum. Felt quite uncomfortable walking there at night. The hotel itself is very clean, with somewhat small rooms which are very comfortable and well appointed. The bed and pillows were very good. The roof deck provided a good city view, and a great place to sit in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: bisonbison
Reviews.Content: We had been camping for quite some time and decided to take a night off and have a nice hot shower in a hotel in Vancouver. We booked through Expedia. The price was average. I was pleased that when we arrived we were told they had run out of the rooms that we wanted and that we were going to be upgraded to one of the penthouse rooms. We were very excited and made our way up to the room. Honestly, we were a little underwhelmed. The room was OKAY, but nothing too special. If I had paid top dollar for it, I would have been disappointed. I kind of wondered what 'regular' rooms would have looked like. It was nice to have a beautiful bathroom with a large tub and shower (which was a nice perk). The sleep was wonderful and bed was comfy. The service at the restaurant in the morning was great. We had to get on the road quick so they made us something to go.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: KT182
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is situated a 5 minute walk from Yaletown which is an urban redevelopment area with many bars, boutiques and restuarants. There is a bus stop and a taxi rank right outside and 2 minutes away is the pick up point for the On/Off bus tours where the first stop is Granville Island. There is a White Spot restaurant adjacent to the Hotel which serves from 7AM - 10PM. The food is good and reasonably priced. Hotel guests get a discount off lunch and dinner. The staff both in the restaurant and the Hotel were all very welcoming, friendly and had plenty of knowledge about Vancouver. Our room was comfotable and well equiped.There is a gym, sauna and jacuzzi but the best feature for us was the rooftop sitting area which afforded us great views as we sat with a glass of wine looking out at the City. Vancouver is a very walkable city divided into distinct areas. We walked back from Stanley Park to the Hotel which gives you an idea about distances. The Hotel also provides a shuttle service which we took advantage of a few times to get dropped off in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveBliss
Reviews.Content: Best quality price/ratio. Near all the facilities. Quiet room, very confortable. People at the reception desk were very helpful. Nice terracce on the top to have a good view of downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Very close by to public transport and the Big Bus tour pick up”
Reviews.Author: PinkLady66
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay there as I said it was only a 5mins walk to the Big Bus pick up, which we did as we only had 2 days there. The staff were friendly and the rooms were lovely and clean and tidy. It had been recommended to me by a friend and I wasnt disappointed

Reviews.Title: “a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Catherine1207908
Reviews.Content: Location was good, hotel staff were friendly and extremely helpful, breakfast was good. Hotel was clean and very comfortable.Near to lots of good restaurants in Yaletown.

Reviews.Title: “I felt safe, and comfortable while traveling solo.”
Reviews.Author: Edutainment
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great bargain. It was very close to sightseeing, and cultural venues. And for places not as close (whale watching), free van service was available. (The hotel also has convenient van service.) However, I walked all over the city, and found my way back to the hotel without a problem. In a single day I went from sightseeing on a mountain, to trolley hopping, to a museum. The restaurant located in the hotel serves good food. I also found myself using the small fridge in my room for munchies bought at the 7-Eleven directly across the street. (If you spill mustard on your shirt, there's a coin operated washing machine in the hotel, next to their playroom. Everything was very neat, and clean.) This hotel isn't in the greatest part of town. There are some characters hanging around. Caution is required. Yet, it was no different from New York City, and I wasn't that concerned. One of my favorite things about this hotel is going up to the roof at night. The view of the city was beautiful, and the Canadian breeze felt like heaven.

Reviews.Title: “rooms are small but overall nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: miss2meow
Reviews.Content: stayed at best western, on draper for four nights in july with my husband and my friend from nl. had a great time, did the 2 day pass on hop on hop off bus. hotel great location for the bus. had a great tour of the city, did stanley park aquarium, wonderful, canada place. took a shuttle from canada place to grousse moutain for the day, awesome. the last day we walked down to the aquabus and went to granville island for the day, later that night we walked the streets and window shopped. the homeless was a bit overwhelming and found them looking for handouts was sad. could not give to everybody. did not like that the homeless bothered us at least 5 times while we were in a closed gated area in the pub on the sidewalk. they just leaned in over and begged. it was too much and getting uncomfortable to enjoy our drinks. overall a great trip and the holet staff were very nice and helpful. the white spot restaurant is a great place to eat and reasonable pricing. good sensible, healthy choices.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: D&MUpnorth
Reviews.Content: Located on Drake St. which is close to the bridge to Granville Island. Neighbourhood is not upscale but new development is happening. Close to bus routes that will get you anywhere in the city. Withing walking distance of the Yaletown area which is full of restaurants, bars and shops. Staff here were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I am not sure if I should come back here or not”
Reviews.Author: tyhoon
Reviews.Content: Located in down town and walking distance to the Sky train station. This is the reason why I booked this hotel. I arrived at the hotel around 3 O'clock in the afternoon of Wednesday but to my surprise I faced many drunkers on the street near by the Hotel. I just did not feel ease fot it.Breakfast is only supplied from 7 O'clock even on week day. I missed it to catch my 9 am flight. Why not from 6:30 like many other hotels?

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel with some service issues”
Reviews.Author: Pottgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice in June 2011, once for a stopover, once for a few days. Its price and location make it a good pick as long as you are aware of a few glitches. They've got the hotel essentials down. The rooms are clean, reasonably large, the beds are good, there's free Wifi, a slightly noisy ac and the shower is nicevand hot. The have a laundry room (2 washers, 2 driers), not the cleanest but still good to have. Also, the location means you can essentially walk anywhere in Downtown, and in 5 minutes you're at the waterfront to catch the aquabus over to Granville Island. Plus, between 7 am and pm, they have a shuttle bus that drops you off at a downtown location of your choice. If you manage to book it, which hints at the main issue: The service is rather hit- and-miss. Everyone is eager and friendly enough, there just doesn't seem to be any communication between the coworkers and there is a permanent rotation of staff - we hardly saw anyone twice, and the quality of information and reliability of arrangements reminded us of staying at the kind of hostel where staff are a mix of a few regulars and a few versoins of "that dude who just arrived from New Zealand". Here's an example: The night before we left we arranged with front desk to get a late checkout at 1 pm. When we woke up, we thought we'd better confirm - called the front desk, who didn't know, but said it was okay. Around 11, housekeeping called to inquire when we would be leaving (we told them about our 1 pm late checkout), and at 12.40, the front desk called again, asking when we were leaving as they had heard from housekeeping we'd be gone by noon. We mentioned this to yet another front-desk attendant when we checked out, saying we'd felt like they were hinting for us to get going. She very politely apologized, checked her computer and confirmed the late check-out had been noted there all the time. Bottom line: Go ahead and book, it's still good value for money. Just better double check on any arrangements you make through staff, or you may find yourself coming downstairs to go somewhere in the shuttle you booked and find it has left early and without you.

Reviews.Title: “It did the trick”
Reviews.Author: RudyLynn
Reviews.Content: This hotel has nice rooms, a great gym, a whirlpool tub, saunas and, best of all, a free shuttle to downtown every half hour. We used the shuttle to visit Chinatown and even to lug our bags to the cruise ship dock, saving a ton on taxis. It's on a creepy block but it's very close to several great neighborhoods, pluses buses and trains.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: bballmama2
Reviews.Content: We had the wonderful opportunity to stay 2 nights at the Best Western. The check in process was prompt. The location of the hotel is on the far end of the street somewhat removed from the busy part of downtown but within walking distance of most shops and eating places. The staff was pleasant and responsive. The paid parking was somewhat crowded in the later hours and there were times we had to wait for a space. The restaurant on-site was easily accessible and had something to offer for all of the family. For the price and the amount of time spent, this was a good deal. The rooms are smaller so be mindful of how many adults and children you plan to put in 1 room. Free WIFI a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but a few problems”
Reviews.Author: tlrf9597
Reviews.Content: We had a large group with families of four that needed 2 queen beds in the rooms, so this hotel fit the bill. We have no complaints about service, location, or cleanliness. The restaurant was great-- very good food and plenty of healthy choices. Wish I could remember our waiter's name in the evening-- he was super friendly and happily figured out and split a very complicated bill for our large group. We were so satisfied with dinner we also ate breakfast in the hotel. We had limited time in Vancouver so caught the hop on hop off Big Bus a block from the hotel. A little pricey, but worth it because we were able to explore Granville Island, Stanley Park, and Gastown in a day plus see many other sights. We were there on the night the Canucks beat the Bruins in game 5 of the Stanley Cup finals and watched the revelers crowded into the blocked off street from the roof of the hotel. There were two main problems: The rooms were really bright at night because of the floodlights trained on the building. It was easy enough to block the light streaming under the door, but no amount of fussing with all the curtains could keep the light from streaming over and between them. It felt like morning all night long. Several others in our group were bothered by the night brightness as well. The other problem was that the sink was not separate from the toilet and shower as is common in hotels today. That made it very inefficient for a family of four with teens that like their privacy to get ready in the morning. If these two issues would not bother you, then I can recommend the hotel to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: racefan59
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for our needs. Walk just about anywhere to anything you want or need (Yaletown, Granville theatres/bars/clubs, Robson St. shopping/restaurants) The area around the hotel is a bit "eclectic" but was very safe during visit. Hotel offers a shuttle service around the downtown which is helpful. Parking is not included but underground is safe and easily accessible. Staff was excellent with out of town travellers. I will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “much better than we expected for a BW”
Reviews.Author: ngjer
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel for a week and we're very pleasantly surprised as we didn't expect too much from a BW. The rooms where big, extremely clean, comfortable and especially quiet. We were on the second floor and the hotel is on Granville street but the room was very very quiet even on Saturday night when the local hockey team won their 2nd game in the Stanley Cup Final and Granville St. was packed with thousands of happy, drunk and noisy fans. The hotel is located within easy walking distance from both the downtown main attractions and Granville Island. We didn't have a car but friends of ours dropped us off at the hotel one night and we entered the parking lot and couldn't understand the bad reviews about it in previous posts. it was very easy to find and very convenient to park in. the area around the hotel can be seen as a bit dodgy but frankly this is Vancouver dodgy, not new-york dodgy - even the dodgy parts seem clean and harmless... our only two complaints are that (a) the toilets clogged a lot (we had to call the hotel plumper twice in one week) and (b) the elevators are way too slow. We waited 10 minutes on Sunday morning when we were trying to check out and finally after 2 elevators arrived packed with passengers (again in 10 minutes!) we dragged our luggage down the stairs to the lobby. Again - these are minor complaints as we had a great stay overall

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jojo1015
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western PLUS Downtown Vancouver for 2 nights with my family. Everything was clean and organized, and the location was very nice if you could enjoy walking a little bit. But, if not, as a bonus, they do provide a shuttle bus to places! The facilities in this hotel were fantastic! They do have a hot tub and a great work-out room with a table tennis, which is always fun. The white Spot in this hotel was also great. Great selections and great service. We highly recommend this hotel and we'll come back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: happytravelpal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great value in Vancouver. The rooms were clean, spacious and well laid out. The room and bathroom were spotless. Location was perfect and most things were walkable. The one issue we did have was in relation to other guests. Throughout the night the two rooms on either side of us would switch from one room to the other allowing the doors to slam shut. They talked and laughed loudly well past 3am. After being disturbed many times I called the front desk who promptly dealt with the situation by sending up security (who they said had already seen to this room earlier in the night...). The noise quietened for all of 5 minutes after security left and started up again. Fitness center, hot tub and table tennis provided entertainment. Free wifi, no free breakfast. Free shuttle was a bonus! Staff also went above and beyond when the shuttle we requested was not available. Overall a decent stay and I would give them my business again with the hopes that we have better neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tipijo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before our Carnival Cruise. Came a day early so we could do some sightseeing around Vancouver. The staff was wonderful to us. The hotel is very secure, you have to use your room key card to even use the elevators. Room was spotless, bathroom was spotless, My husband used the fitness center. It's not huge but had enough that he was happy with the equipment. There is a restaurant in the hotel. The food was wonderful. We had a dessert and coffee. The desserts were so big that we had to take half back to our room, they were to die for. Dinner was wonderful and so was breakfast. Great food. When we had to go to the Ship, there is a shuttle that will take you there. They also have bicycles at the hotel it you want to use them. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel to spend 8 days”
Reviews.Author: fran8
Reviews.Content: We must agree with the last reviewer. We received a kitchenette with refrigerator, stove, and microwave. The room was clean and comfortable. We found the front desk very friendly, helpful and extremely responsive. Special thanks to Shawn. Had a problem getting emails. They immediately sent a clerk to our room to assist us. The shuttle was great. We would recommend this hotel as a moderately priced place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & socialable staff - great experience”
Reviews.Author: AnilSood
Reviews.Content: Thorughly enjoyed the dream city destination,as I call it ; Vancouver..equally enjoyable is the hotel..Jennifer, Luke, Lisa - great people to have met...Anil Sood New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “Have no doubts - This is the Best Value for Money in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: MartimM
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have reviewed a hotel using TripAdvisor which should immediately highlight my satisfaction of the stay. I made a reservation at the Downtown Plus for my sister and niece who were visiting me following my recent arrival in Vancouver - mainly this decision was made as a consequence of the great feedback online and personal recommendations from friends. In retrospect, I can honestly state that the staff could not have done more to accommodate my visitors and went out of their way to ensure they enjoyed their stay. The hotel itself is well decorated, very clean and has the bonus of a gym/hot tub/laundry facility on the Penthouse level - something you would not expect at such a reasonable price. I would like to thank the staff personally for all their efforts - I dealt specifically with Coco, Luke and Lisa but have no doubts that the rest of the team would have dealt with my queries/requirements equally as well. I am certain to use this hotel again when I have visitors in town and can not recommend thier service highly enough. BRAVO!

Reviews.Title: “Good value option”
Reviews.Author: arf68
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this hotel. We have stayed at numerous other hotels in the vicinity and would rate this one close to the top of the ones we know. We got a very good room rate--much below that of the other hotels we know--which made for very good value. Our typical choice in the area is the Cascadia, but we were wary of the renovation work happening there, so decided to try somewhere different this time out. Pros/notables: -the location is convenient, and there is good public transit nearby -staff were exuberantly friendly on check-in, and only slightly less so on check-out (great staff elevate this place, in my view). While we were checking, one guest seemed to have lost her car in the parkade: one of the desk clerks offered to walk the parkade with the guest until the vehicle was found. I presume it was as we saw the clerk again a few minutes later--this is going above and beyond as far as I am concerned. Well done. -the room was decent and clean, and the kitchenette was welcome; overall, the room was what we expect from Best Western: serviceable but not luxurious -the wireless internet worked great for us Cons: -the location is not the most scenic that one can find in the area--it is at the foot of the Granville Street Bridge, and the corner it is on is a little tawdry. However, there isn't much to differentiate the location from that of other nearby hotels, and it certainly was much quieter than Hornby Street (around the corner) where we usually stay -no windows opened in our room: I like to be able to open at least one window, even if only a crack, to get some fresh air circulating in the room

Reviews.Title: “Girls Get Away-Bon Jovi”
Reviews.Author: purplepower1981
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel way in advance for a girl's get away to see Bon Jovi as they weren't playing in Seattle this tour. I have stayed at alot of Best Western's and this place only disappointed me on two minor things. One being the restaurant, very slow (40min wait to be seated) and the breakfast (over 40 mins to be served) and the food wasn't that great. There is a place over the Cambie Bridge called Biercraft and it was AWESOME for breakfast, be sure to check it out. The other thing was the room was very stuffy at night and made for uncomfortable night of sleeping. We found out when we checked out that the thermostats were still set to winter mode so that is why the room never got below 65 degrees....ugh!! Won't forget to ask that next time so they can adjust it accordingly. We were able to check in early, which is nice. The rooms were nicely set up, had a small kitchenette and the bathroom was roomy with great towels. Beds were very comfortable and the front desk help were very nice and helpful. I had no problems with the internet as other have mentioned/experienced. Parking is somewhat tight and if they are booked full, good luck finding a space...could be a problem but wasn't for us. Be sure the go to the penthouse level and check out the great view from up there and the hot tub....nice!! One place to be sure to eat dinner is the Yaletown Brewery, great beers and drinks, awesome food and nice people!! Try the Red Dragon, dangerous! LOL Can't wait to make another trip up to Vancouver, maybe next month!

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff especially manager great location”
Reviews.Author: ally5SunshineCoast
Reviews.Content: After a most difficult journey from Australia with my 80 year old mother , we arrived here totally exhausted. This was just the beginning of our problems. Somehow our reservations had been cancelled (we still don't know by whom) and we were really distraught. Seeing our distress the manager told us that although all the rooms were all booked for the night we could have the penthouse suite and sort everything out in the morning. After finally contacting our travel agent in oz, all was ok. I will never forget his kindness and have recommended this hotel to everyone I know who is travelling to Vancouver as well as the travel agency. thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: EmmaSG
Reviews.Content: I stayed five nights at this hotel in a double ensuite room on the ninth floor. As i ordered in advance the room was about £50/night. If you compare this place to £50 British hotel they are like chalk and cheese. The room although not huge was beautifully furnished and spotless. Lovely bathroom with loads of fluffy towels and nice toiletries. The bed was extremely comfy and there was plenty of bedding etc. There was a coffee maker, coffee and tea in the room; a hairdryer; iron and board; even an umbrella! I was on the ninth floor overlooking granville bridge - there was a little bit of traffic noise in the early evening but nothing to disturb sleep. The location is excellent. Yaletown is right on the doorstep with great restaurants, almost the whole of downtown is easily walkable, and if you want to hop on a bus to Granville/Kits/Stanley Park it couldn't be easier. I'm a girl travelling alone and thought the neighborhood felt very safe, with lots of people about, and very close to upmarket shopping areas and friendly nightlife. The attached White Spot restaurant was good but there isnt much choice for breakfast. You only have to walk a couple of blocks to find better alternatives. Also wroth noting that the free shuttle will only take you from the hotel to downtown locations, not back. The little gym, jacuzzi and saunas were a nice extra. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff extremly helpful, another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: angelsSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here not so long ago and it was still as good as the last stay. The staff bend over backwards for you they are so helpful, the rooms are clean cosy and comfortable, all at a more affordable price. Excellent location as it is so close to Yaletown!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, wonderful staff all very helpful!”
Reviews.Author: angelsSydney
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel very helpful staff will bend over backwards for you, we were given a suite on the penthouse floor so we were very impressed indeed! They have a ping pong table which was fun and a little spa tub and a gym on the top floor. The only negative I would say was there seems to be a few homeless people hanging around this area, they have no connection to the hotel, it is more that seems to be a problem actually both in Vancouver downtown and even Vancouver Island, but we would definitely stay here again it was a very nice surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Our fav hotel in downtown Van!”
Reviews.Author: P2Photo
Reviews.Content: Our "Go-To" place for any last minute Vancouver trip. I love that you can count on always having a clean room, the same friendly smiling faces, and a friendly chauffeur standing by with his free shuttle bus to take you right to where you want to go, no map or bus fair needed! We've only had good stays at the Best Western Downtown, highly recommendable. As another person mentioned, You'd be surprised how flexible these people can be if you ask about upgrades and packages. :)

Reviews.Title: “Average room Quality With Poor Customer Service.”
Reviews.Author: KassandraAlana
Reviews.Content: Came for an overnight stay. Check in was great and didnt have any problems that night, except for trying to park my SUV in the TINY parking garage that they make you pay for. Whatever, no big deal. Went out and came back that night and went to bed. The beds werent that comfortable but they werent the worst ever. In the morning though, in cleaning crew were so loud that they woke my friend and I up out of a dead sleep at 8 in the morning. When we got up, i check the room book that gives a list of all the hotels ammenities to check for a breakfast. Sure enough, they offered in the book (diredt quote) "A continental breakfast or hot breakfast is available from 7:00am to 10:30am daily in the White Spot Restaurant located at the hotel lobby for free." When we went down stairs to the restaurant, the bartender told us someone would be with us shortly. We stood there for five minutes and he didnt come over to seat us until AFTER two guys had walked in behind us. He came and asked us if we wanted a table for two and i asked if they were still serving their continental breakfast (it was (930am). He proceeded to tell me that they dont offer that and that the restaurant was separate from the hotel and that it would only be free if we had vouchers from the hotel. That was fine but when i tried to tell him that the rooms book advertised a breakfast, he cut me off and proceeded to talk over me and tell me "NO, youre wrong!" and was absolutely rude! I just turned around and walked away while he continued talking. I will not be going back to this hotel and most likely wont be staying at any best western again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: takanooki
Reviews.Content: We stayed almost a week in this hotel, so we could try to know downtown vancouver, and the hotel helped us in this job. The room was always very clean, a little tiny, but very comfortable, with a good view of Granville Bridge. The location is great, let us visit most part of downtown, all shopping areas and malls very close. A lot of restaurants that you can take-out if want to have dinner in the hotel. It's not awesome, but the White Spot burgers are worth, if just dont want to leave the hotel to eat. The hotel offers free shuttle to most places in downtown, but dont pick up back. Aquabus to Granville Island is just 2 blocks away, don't miss the visit to the market. A Jacuzzi, table tennis, fitness center do the entertainement. The Laundry is very very small, but worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “great breakfasts !”
Reviews.Author: samanthamarshall
Reviews.Content: this hotel is typical of the best western style. As a basic chain of hotels it is everything you would expect. clean and neat, nothing outstanding, but a good hotel. it is a great location. and within walking distance of all the things you would visit in downtown vancouver. the breakfasts were superb, infact all the food was stunning, however right on your doorstep is a great array of wierd and wonderful eateries. there is plenty to do and see in vancouver so you wont spend much time in this hotel. the rooms differ in size and not necessarily accrding to the price (we were in a group so we saw lots of the rooms) having all paid the same rate some had better and bigger rooms than others. If you are not happy with the room you are given ask to change. the staff are quite friendly and helpful. great hotel, great stay !

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice!”
Reviews.Author: LannyMR
Reviews.Content: Room size is big enough, kitchenette is available, bed is good, bathroom is clean, laundry is available.... Very comfortable room...complete with study desk and extra desk for 2 person working in the room. We stayed there for 5nights and continue again for 3 other nights...

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but not to sleep”
Reviews.Author: RedboatLake
Reviews.Content: My wife and i spent 4 nights at this hotel. We know Vancouver well, but this is the first time at this hotel. It seems a little out of place, as the neighborhood is in transition. It's right at the end of the Granville Street Bridge, across from the Yale Hotel. The Yale is the Premiere Blues entertainment spot in town, and pretty rough. Night time is not very comfortable at street level. Rooms are clean, comfortable, and updated. Exercise room, guest laundry, and rooftop lounge are nice touches. We bought the breakfast package. It's a voucher for a $10.00 breakfast at the White Spot restaurant attached to the hotel lobby. Certainly far from the best White Spot I've eaten at, but the staff were friendly. Now for the no sleep part. We were on thee 7th floor. At first I thought maybe there was a window open. I could hear conversations from the street below, and the traffic noise was deafening at times. I told my wife to be sure to remember to wait for the WALK sign before she got up from bed to go to the washroom at night, or she might get run over by one of the buses I was sure ran right beside the bed. I finally began to wonder if perhaps there were a series of parabolic microphones at street level connected to amplifiers and speakers under our bed. I truly believe my little nylon camping tent has more sound deadening ability than the hotel walls, and this applies to the interior walls as well. Several times I was woken up by what I honestly thought were people coming into our room in the middle of the night. I heard that Mission Impossible 4 was being filmed a few blocks away during the nights we were there, so there is a small chance that some of the noise came from chase scenes, but surely not all. Anyhow, a nice place - but bring ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: cruzaddicts
Reviews.Content: This was my second 2 night stay, although it isn't a prime location (hookers and junks), i never felt unsafe here, but was happy our car was safely tucked away in the hotel garage. They have several packages to choose from, which gives an added value to your stay at this place. On the top floor they have a fitness/spa area with breathtaking views over Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: nokaoi27
Reviews.Content: Was in town on business and picked this hotel for its location. Great stay. Room was a bit small, but that wasn't an issue since I was alone. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful (particularly Roxana who checked me in and two days later, out). The bed was very comfortable and provided a wonderful night's rest. I'd come back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “comfy beds, good stay.”
Reviews.Author: cmwpm
Reviews.Content: Besides the fact that the front desk accidentaly gave the wrong keys to a buisness man checking in soon after us (he walked in our room with us in it and then ran quickly back out), and that the hot-tub was under maintenance, the beds were comfy, location was convenient to walk to restaraunts, bars, and shops, and we had adjoining rooms which made our stay quite nice. Also, we got a free upgrade for one of our rooms, and the front desk staff were real nice. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time just ok”
Reviews.Author: StV_8
Reviews.Content: This is my second time in this hotel. Stayed last year and found the quality of the room not as good. The airconditiong did not work thus the room was hot. I was near the ice machine which was noisy. The location is great, close to skytrain, Davie Street, Granville Island ferry.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is within walking distance of shops and restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: cornishdragon2
Reviews.Content: Most of the shops and restaurants are within fifteen minutes walk of the hotel.The hotel does serve a good breakfast but allow enough time to enjoy it as it gets busy at peak times.Large rooms with microwave,safe,fridge,Plasma TV,tea/coffee maker.Bath room has a good power shower and all toiletries are provided.You can walk to the Waterfront and wander around if you like to get away from the busy shopping areas.We had a good meal at the White Spot and there is Dennys if you enjoy diner type meals.

Reviews.Title: “Hooker Central and terrible service....but the room was great.”
Reviews.Author: CEV-RN
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my birthday weekend, and the room was great. Really clean, very comfortable. But the service from the front-desk staff/concierge was HORRIBLE. When I arrived, myself and a friend were struggling with a large luggage cart with a crazy wheel trying to unsuccessfully steer it down a steep ramp in the lobby. The concierge/desk-staff and bellman sat there watching us struggle, there was no one else in the lobby, and they eventually yelled at us "Oh, just kick the wheel and it should straighten out!!". They couldn't even get off their butts to help us out. I had dinner reservations and understood from the web-site that there was shuttle service available. The concierge explained that there was no shuttle that evening but promised to have cabs waiting for myself and friends to make our dinner reservations on-time. When I arrived in the lobby with my friends there was no cab waiting and when I checked with the front-desk they just shrugged their shoulders and said, 'we called them'. My friends and I ended up in the rain in our party-dresses and high-heels trying to flag one down. Later in the evening I was in the lobby waiting on some friends. I was there not even 10 minutes and I saw at least 5 different men come in separately with hookers (unmistakable) and the front-desk clerk and posted security guard didn't bat not an eye-lash. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for anyone, but especially not families. These 'ladies of the evening' were wearing see-through dresses and no underwear--not something you want your child to see. Also, I forgot my toothbrush, so I called the front-desk requesting one. They said, 'no problem, we'll be right up with it'. Over an hour went by and still no toothbrush so I rang the desk again. They incredibly terse reply was, 'Sorry, we're too busy, you'll have to go without!' And lastly, the girl at the desk who checked me out was a witch! She was rude and impatient, refused to give me a refund receipt for the deposit on my VISA and refused to provide explanation. I asked for a feedback card and how to contact the hotel manager and she refused to provide that too. I left feeling so ticked off and angry that I'd forgotten all the fun of my birthday.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for a comfortable bed, look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: hr45
Reviews.Content: My bed was hard and uncomfortable. I slept well the first night only because I had just traveled 12 + hours. Asked the check in staff for a list of restaurants or ones he would recommend, but he just gave us a map and circled where Yaletown was (walking distance) and said there was a guest book in the room. Guestbook wasn't too helpful either. About 10-15 mins to Stanley Park, Gastown, and Canada Place. Located right over the bridge near Granville Island, still didn't hear any traffic outside my window, but that's probably because I had my heater blowing all night. Had the heat set at 70 and it was still blowing out cold air, had to turn it up to 75 to feel warm. Had to pay for parking, but I'm used to that for a hotel in a city. Fitness center and pool located on the top floor, restaurant attached-didn't check it out either. Free high speed internet. Business center consists of one computer. Shuttle to downtown runs 7am to 7pm. Complimentary bicycle rentals. I probably would not stay here again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Nieuwerkerk aan den Ijssel, The Netherlands
Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jethroborsje
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just a little south of downtown vancouver, but you can easily walk there. There is no breakfast service in the hotel, but attached to the hotel there is nice restaurant where you can have a good breakfast. The staff there is very friendly. Please take in mind you'll have to pay for your parking space, it's about 15 CAD a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & good location in Yaletown”
Reviews.Author: jodysloft
Reviews.Content: I'm picky - and this is a good hotel - not fancy, but perfect if you are out all day and just need a comfortable clean room. Free WiFi. Area is in transition but safe. Ride the Skytrain from Vancouver airport and detrain at Roundhouse station- hotel is a 7 minute walk. Great little restaurant nearby Twisted Fork.Also recommend Provence and The Hub - both in Yaletown. Vancouver is one of the very best cities to walk - so wear comfy shoes and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “most helpful and accomodating staff I've had to deal with”
Reviews.Author: mgj5152
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western at 718 Drake Street in Vancouver, 9/8/10 coming from New York to then board a cruise ship the next day . We had a few problems with the trip including lost luggage, and a mix up on the transfer from the airport. None of the issues involved the hotel, howevever they couldn't do enough to make it right. They ever upgraded our room to the penthouse suite! The manager was outstanding!!!!! They really do care! MG Jacon Cohoes, NY

Reviews.Title: “Great check in, room excellent”
Reviews.Author: Yggdrasil98
Reviews.Content: I arrived early on a long haul flight and was thrilled my room was ready in the morning. Check in was smooth and efficient and reception was helpful all the time I stayed. I stayed two single nights with a business trip in between and hotel stored my excess bag,

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: EmmaLou67
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for two nights before going on a cruise to Alaska. The staff was excellent. We especially appreciated the bellman, Shawn, and his helpful suggestions. The van to downtown locations and the cruise ships was welcome. The hotel was clean and well equipped. As with many older hotels, the room was a bit small, but very managable.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good hotel but reasonable location.”
Reviews.Author: Vicvictor
Reviews.Content: the room was small. The air conditioner was VERY loud and woke us up every time it started at night. it was very hard to watch TV with the air conditioner on. The only good thing here is the location which is very close to Granville island (by car) and to the cool Davis street.

Reviews.Title: “Better than a Fairmont!”
Reviews.Author: JaniePet
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after staying at the Fairmont Waterfront (as part of a package) and it was ten times better. The room was clean and comfortable and there was also a fridge and microwave. You even got a free bottle of water (something you had to pay $6 for at the fairmont!!) I would definitely stay here again over a fairmont any day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: spencer1234
Reviews.Content: I went to Vancouver to visit my relatives. And this hotel really has excellent services, so I'm here to write about it and to thanks their stuffs. I feel very welcomed and the stay is pleasurable. I would recommend it to my friends and I will come back next time.

Reviews.Title: “one of my favor hotel to stay in Van”
Reviews.Author: worjerry
Reviews.Content: I was glad to stay in this hotel , friendly and knowlegable staffs, clean room, free bottle water, free shuttle service, what more can I say? I just love this hotel and will recommend this to all of my friends and relatives.. don't miss the best - Best Western Downtown Vancouver hotel. you will regret not to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient location and very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn4407
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean, the location convenient, free shuttle to tourist locations and very helpful staff when we needed upcoming reservations will make this a hotel we would go to again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: vacay2vacay
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel after our cruise ended in Vancouver. We chose this hotel because we didn't want to pay $300 & up, which seemed to be the average price for a 4 star hotel in Vancouver. We had a 2 queen bedroom. It had good light, with the view of the Granville Bridge. The room was clean and good size considering we had 3 large suitcases and were able to lay every one of them to open. The beds were comfy and had nice white linens and duvets. They provided 2 free bottles of water everyday, which was very nice. There was a small fridge, a writing desk, and free tea and coffee maker. Free internet is available at the lobby area. The concierge staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel did help us keep our luggage after we checked out, but not yet ready to go to the airport. The hotel provides free shuttle to drop off guests to anywhere in downtown, but not to pick up. This hotel tends to get very busy in the morning through around noon time due to the cruise ship passengers. Therefore, if you need to take the free shuttle around this time, you need to make sure to reserve a space. This hotel is located on the South side of downtown Vancouver. There are plenty of night life around the hotel, but we didn't hear any noise. On Saturday night, a few blocks up, the streets were blocked off for pedestrian entertainment. The location is quite convenient, since Vancouver is not that big anyway. From the cruise ship terminal, it took about 5-10 mins taxi ride, that cost about $10. From the hotel to the airport, it's about 30 mins taxi ride and cost about $30/$40.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the range budget hotel, modern, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: northernscientist
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights while touring Canada. The taxi from Vancouver airport takes around 20-25 minutes. On arrival the staff were friendly and full of suggestions on what to do during our stay. You can pre-book a free shuttle bus with them for sightseeing or to take you to the airport/ train station. The room was excellent, large, clean with very comfortable beds and a well-equipped en-suite. We were particularly impressed with the coffee machine in the room (with vanilla milk - yummy!) and the alarm clock/ radio with an iPod docking station. The local area around the hotel is a liitle run-down, and we saw quite a number of homeless people (some of who had a strange tendency to follow you) but we never felt in the least threatened.
