It's about a 25 min walk down Granville Street to Gastown but other good areas like Davie Street are also within easy walking distance. Can recommend the 2 Parrots for breakfast (5 min down Granville, gorgeous fluffy buttermilk pancakes and English waitress!). It's also very close to the hop-on/ off tourist bus route. Highly recommended for the price/ quality.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING BEST WESTERN”
Reviews.Author: Msco2
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided to drive up to Vancouver for a short getaway trip from Seattle. This was the hotel caught our attention once we got off the granville bridge. We did not make a reservation since this was a last min roadtrip we decided to do. Luckily, the hotel wasn't sold out. Front desk agent was very helpful, knowledgable about the area and friendly. The room was sportless with an ipod dock, flat scream tv and free bottle water, tea and coffee. Parking was only $10 plus taxes a night. We enjoyed our stay very much. We will for sure recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Best Western”
Reviews.Author: aquarius80
Reviews.Content: It was ok, though the room was rather small. A/C was noisy, but could be unplugged. In walking distance from city center. Typical Best Western style, brown colors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Oldsk8r
Reviews.Content: Check-in and Conciege team were friendley, efficient and knowledgable. Good downtown location - close to skyrail and Yaletown. Room was a good size and bed was fantastic. Internet was fast and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Yanwan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here post- cruise for 2 nights with my parents and sister in June 2010. I'll be honest. Coming from the other side of the world, I've never stayed in a Best Western before. This was my first and I was pleasantly surprised. The friendly bellman welcomed us and helped us with our luggage upon our arrival and showed us to the reception where we were attended to by very friendly staff. Our room was not ready but the receptionist was more than happy to introduce us to the attractions in Vancouver. I had some items shipped to the hotel and they were all stored properly and safely before my arrival. Impressed. The room that we got was large. It had a big flat screen TV, double beds, wardrobe, desk, iHome and lounge chairs. Not to mention we had a great view of the Granville Bridge. The lighting could have been brighter. Beds were comfortable and furnishings were new. We didn't eat anything from the hotel's restaurant, White Spot. The hotel is about a 20 minute walk from the main shopping streets of Downtown Vancouver. You could take a bus too but we preferred to walk. There was a 7-11 on the opposite street. Overall, I enjoyed every moment of my stay with this hotel and see myself returning here in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: norfolkducks
Reviews.Content: Could not find a single problem with this hotel. Very clean and comfortable, lovely beds and very spacious room. Good sized bathroom. Staff exceptionally helpful with advice on where to eat. Area very good for getting round Vancouver with the Hop on Bus stopping right outside the door. The White Spot restaurant which is next to the hotel is excellent for a very substantial breakfast. Hotel has a laundry room with dryer which weused as we had just arrived back from a cruise. Doing the laundry before the next step of our holiday was a great help. Great views from the roof. Jacuzzi also on the roof but not used by ourselves. Cannot go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: MikeandLyndaC
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel on a month long visit to Canada, and have to say it was superb. Having stayed in Vancouver before, we were a little unsure about staying Downtown, but if you have any doubts, forget them as its location is much better than we ever anticipated. Getting from the airport, use the Skytrain and get off at Roundhouse station and the hotel is only four blocks up from the station. We made it easily but could be a problem if you have a lot of luggage, as we travel light. The receptionists are very helpful and check-in was speedy. The rooms are not massive, but are more than adequate and very clean, and we were than happy with the view. Unusually for this class of hotel, there was a roof terrace, a Jacuzzi and saunas. What more could you ask for? The promenade along the Frazer river is five minutes away, and the walks along it are superb, and ferries go to Granville Island market from here. With the skyrail being so close, it is easy to get around to any part of the city in minutes, but if you need to go to the Cruise Terminal in Canada Place, there is a complimentary shuttle bus to take you there.

Reviews.Title: “Best Best Western we've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: QueenStoneage
Reviews.Content: I wish all Best Western hotels were like this one. We stayed a total of 5 nights, but in two different rooms. Although we preferred our first room, both were clean and spacious, the beds comfortable, the aircon worked (essential as the windows don’t open) plus both had all the required amenities. The staff was friendly and helpful. I was most delighted with the low noise levels, despite the hotel being fully booked. The walls appear thick and you can’t hear any steps and furniture moving from the room above. You are also spared traffic noise due to double glazed windows and the hotel’s position just outside the main centre. The immediate surroundings and views aren’t the most scenic, but the hotel’s location is perfect for shopping, exploring and eating out (we particularly liked dining in Yaletown, which is also where the closest SkyTrain station is situated, a 5-10 minute walk). Yaletown station is also a direct 30 min ride to/from the airport and will cost you CAD 3.75 pp as opposed to a CAD 35 cab ride. Just bear in mind that the Hotel lies a little uphill from the station, something you may notice if you are schlepping luggage! The Best Western Downtown is brilliant value for money (Vancouver isn’t cheap) and I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: aotearoanz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Best Western for two nights on our arrival in Vancouver. It was a good location and we were able to walk to most places easily. The room was clean and spacious and well equipped. They had free wireless internet access which was reliable and secure car parking on site although we had to pay for this.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel0982
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights with my husband and 3 year old daughter in April 2010. This is a very good hotel and the location is great. Its right on granville street and is very close to robson street(mecca of shopping & dining). The hotel has secure, underground parking for $10CAD per night which is reasonable in downtown. The total I paid for four nights was $447CAD(which includes parking, taxes) The rooms were very clean and the house keeping was exceptional. Our room came with 2 queen beds, flatscreen TV, mini-fridge & microwave. The rooom was a decent size and came with a downtown view. Best western offers 2 free water bottles every day. They have a jacuzzi on the pent house, though we didnot use it. There are some picnic tables on the roof top and they had a great view. They hotel offers a complimentary shuttle drop off service. The hotel also rents bikes free of charge for 2 hrs. There is also 7-eleven just acroos the hotel which was very handy especially if you have kids. They have free internet in the lounge. The only thing is that they dont offer complimentary breakfast. I would definetly recommend this hotel because of the price and the amenities they offer and proximinty to major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly, and clean”
Reviews.Author: 19nat89
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very clean and great location. Close to public transport, shopping and restaurants. Has a cafe/restaurant that is open from breakfast til dinner. They also offer a free shuttle service every 30 minutes which was very helpful. There is a good sized fitness centre on the top floor, with a hot tub. Staff were helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Msgeocat
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Downtown in Vancouver is a good value hotel. It is functional as opposed to luxurious - but overall the rooms are well maintained - the beds really comfortable - and the staff are very nice. They also offer a free shuttle bus which is very handy. The hotel is located on Granville Street - it can get a bit wild and a little noisy on Granville street on the weekend nights - but the hotel itself feels safe and secure. We were in the room with the kitchenette - if you having a longer stay this is a good option as the kitchenette includes a stovetop (small), microwave and decent sized bar fridge. Although it is in close proximity to good resturants. In the lobby there is a computer and you are able to get free internet there - just ask for a code from the staff. Also free wireless in your room if you have your own computer. The location of the hotel itself is very good - a short walk to the main shopping districts of downtown Vancouver and the skytrain - also a short walk to the Aqua bus which will get you to Granville island very easily. Oh and the water is great there too - tap water is fine but they also offer bottled water (free) - you can even ask for extra bottles to take out during the day. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and when I go back to Vancouver (hopefully soon!) I would stay there again! Also my Mum stayed with us and even though it was three sharinig the room there was still plenty of room for everyone. Plus my Mum really liked the shuttle bus and thought the driver was very friendly and knowledgable - added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: Kiranananth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on business travel. Nice place, clean rooms & with all basic amenities - All that you would expect in a Bestwestern Hotel. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: SDSYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We booked a one night stay here the day before driving up to Vancouver from Seattle. It was our first trip and we really didn't know where was best to saty in terms of sightseeing and getting around. We only paid around £60.00 including breakfast and free parking which was a bonus. We were greeted by a friendly receptionist who allowed us to check in early at no extra charge. There was some confusion as to the parking being free but she eventually agreed it was and remarked no-one had noted it on the booking. The manager came over and introduced him self personally to us, even gave us his business card as he had overheard the confusion regarding the parking. He was so friendly and nice asking about England etc.. it was nice but a bit OTT really. The room was great, far better than I had expected views up into the city centre (away from the bridge which the hotel is just over - on the left hand side making it a doddle to find). The curtains were really good black out ones, the bathroom was neat and tidy with everything clean and well presented. We had a tea tray, ice bucket, great sized TV, everything you could want and more really for our purpose - I didn't take my first trip to Canada to sit in a hotel room! You can walk to pretty much everything in the downtown area if you don't mind walking which didn't - 30-40 up to gastown and china town (with lots to see on the way I hasten to add). Breakfast the next morning was great and you got a real plate full! It was the hot breakfast option included not the full breakfast but it was plenty for us choice of Juice OR hot drink and then a huge plate of bacon, egg, sausage etc... We did book the shuttle bus they promote in the morning to take us up to the top end of town for the day which all went a bit wrong really - I can't remember the exact times but we booked it and then they called the room 15 minutes early and said we would have to go then or in an hour because the driver was waiting - they do not operate the shuttle so have little control over it really, we weren't ready to check out so had to pass on the shuttle and walk into town - not the end of the world but a little disappointing as they made a thing about the fact you could only book certain times in advance which we did! They did allow us to keep the car in the garage all day at no extra charge whilst we went sightseeing till tea time which was nice of them. They also have a rooftop garden which was good for a few pictures and imagine is nice in summer when it's a bit warmer! The gym was up there too and it looked fine enough to me for a small hotel. All in all we found it a great place to stay in Vancouver and I would not really hesitate to stay there again next time I visited

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, nice staff and excellent room”
Reviews.Author: Empire11
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel located in downtown Vancouver, which has friendly and helpful staff. We stayed there for one night after staying at the Hyatt Regency. First of all, the room was less expensive than the Hyatt, and it contained furnishings that were comparable to the Hyatt’s. In fact, the LCD TV was bigger than the Hyatt’s. Second, the Best Western offers 2 free bottled waters (compared to $5 at the Hyatt), free local calls and free wi fi internet. There is also a laundry room on site, which is convenient. The towels and toiletries were plentiful, and of good quality. This location also offers a free shuttle service to any destination within 5 miles. This hotel was a refreshing change to the Hyatt, which seems to charge for everything. I would recommend staying here anytime, a look forward to returning on my next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: missjennymarie
Reviews.Content: Typical Best Western with a little more comfort. The room was clean and comfortable (a little on the small side) but the bed was outstanding. Great decor in the room and a huge triple-sheeted bed...for people who dislike hotel bedding...this will put you at ease. Lovely sheets, clean and extremely comfortable. The location is great, right downtown and within walking distance to public transit (which I suggest taking. It's nice not having to be in traffic and pay for parking all day!)...also being on Granville street, it's the perfect location for shopping and going out at night. The fitness room and hot tub are up on the Pent House level and offer a great view. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family. The only drawback that it has is there are no balconies...which is a shame when its a beautiful night and you have to go upstairs to sit on the common patio. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but....”
Reviews.Author: travelbugenthusiast
Reviews.Content: Good location, only about 3 blocks into the downtown streets. Was very easy to find coming from off the highway. Stay was good for what i expected with a few exceptions. When we first arrived, we went to check in and the man at reception was very un-welcoming, made me very uncomfortable. After checking us in, with the bar minimum effort we parked the car and headed up to our room, walked in the room, and was blasted with the smell of smoke. It was quite strong and i wanted to change rooms, but felt reluctant to call reception and bother them after a not-so-nice check in. Eventually did, and was asked to come back down to reception to get our new room key. After heading down and picked up or new key, it almost felt like the gentleman (same one that checked us in) didnt believe us, and pointed out that it couldnt smell like smoke as it was a non-smoking hotel, well someone obviously broke that rule! After going into a new room, everything was perfect. Headed out that evening, and when returned was greeted by a different gentleman at reception that was extremely kind and full of smiles. Check out was a breeze. The hotel was nice, but due to my un-welcome welcoming would not reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good downtown location, very convenient to Canada Place”
Reviews.Author: safety_princess
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before we went on a Princess Cruise that left from Canada Place. We weren't renting a car so I was looking for a hotel that wasn't too far from Canada Place and where we can walk to restaurants and attractions. This hotel fit the bill. There certainly were other hotels that were closer to Canada Place but they were much more expensive. This hotel wasn't cheap but it was reasonable for what we were looking for. There were other hotels in the area in the same price range but I was glad we picked this hotel. The room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious. They gave you 2 free bottles of water every day so we didn't have to buy any. There were several eating establishments nearby to choose from - restaurants, diners to a Tim Horton. Only drawback was that it didn't have a pool. The front desk clerks were very helpful. They have a free shuttle that will take you anywhere downtown w/in a 5-10 mile radius one-way. So we used this service to take us to Canada Place. I thought we would have to get a taxi but they said that this is what the shuttle is for. The hotel was 2 blocks away from one of those "Hop on Hop off" trolley tour stops. It's also not far from Granville Island where there is a water taxi service to take you there from the mainland. Overall, it was a very nice hotel. I would stay there again if I were to take another cruise from Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: AngelaG
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights - one each end of our trip - and found it to be a good location for downtown without the high price of being in Robson Street or on the waterfront. We were able to walk to Davie Street, where there is a good selection of restaurants, and the seawall which is a beautiful strolling area. Our first room had a kitchen area the second didn't, but both were a good size, clean and quiet despite the hotel being situated on a busy corner. We had a problem with the door key on our second stay. It wouldn't open the door and was re-keyed three times before it worked, but the staff were very helpful. Parking is $10 per day, but it is underground and reasonably secure. We had two breakfasts and one evening meal in the restaurant and found it good and a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western is Best!”
Reviews.Author: Renatevanaerts
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with my children (10 and 7 years). We had an appointment in BC Children Hospital the next day and Best Western is close to the hospital. We were located at the back of the hotel on the 5th floor, what gave us an awsome view in the evening. The room was very large with an extra area as a living room with 2nd tv where you could sit when the children were asleep. I also liked the idea that my car was parked under the hotel and that it was safe there. My children and I went for dinner and we did not feel uncomfortable on the streets. There were some homeless people here and there, but the streets is were they live. I don't mind my children seeing this side of the world. Not everybody is able to life in the comfort of a home with family or friends. The next morning we had a lovely breakfast in the new renovated restaurant. The food was excellent and fresh and the restaurant felt very comfortable. It is a good place to go to have breakfast even if you live in Vancouver. I would definitely go back to Best Western in the future.

Reviews.Title: “good value for downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunwor
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Best Western Downtown Vancouver. We ended up having our grand daughter stay with us, so needed two beds instead of the one. This was done quickly, and with no charge. The room was very nice, clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. We walked down 3 blocks and were in Yale town, which has many, many restaurants to chose from. We felt that the price was very good and the stay was very comfortable. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: TaminatorToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night in September 2009 prior to an Alaskan cruise. The primary reason we chose the hotel was because we could use airmiles gift certificates to pay for it. The positives: 1. Location. We were meeting people at a pub on Davie Street for a pre-cruise get-together. We could walk there and back easily. Plus there was lots of shopping (Shoppers, covenience and liquor store) a stone's throw from the hotel. 2. Staff. This hotel has awesome staff. I never caught anyone's names but I probably dealt with about 4 different front desk staff and they were all extremely pleasant and helpful. 3. Downtown Shuttle. Even though it's not on any kind of schedule, the staff goes out of their way to try to get you on this shuttle and get you to where you need to go. Free of charge. A small minus about the shuttle is that it does service a few local hotels so it does get busy. Just book it as soon as you can in the morning and you should be alright. 4. Cleanliness. The room and lobby were immaculate. As it should be. 5. Comfy beds and pillows. Not too hard, not too soft. Negatives: 1. The air con/heating. It was noisy! I'm a light sleeper and was consumed by pre-cruise excitement so it bothered me. My partner on the other hand can sleep through anything so barely noticed it. 2. The light from the hallway shone like a laser through the peephole in the door. See my notes above about sleeping habits. I should have moved the lamp so it blocked it but this, of course, did not occur to me until the morning. Overall it was a very good place to stay and I would recommend it if you are only staying for a short stay or can sleep through the things that bothered me.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, not more.”
Reviews.Author: checkerin
Reviews.Content: Curtains don't close properly so we were blinded by the street lights. Bathrooms could be cleaned a little better. It's quite a long walk from the city centre to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Allkar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights whilst visiting Vancouver. The room was very well appointed, very clean, good standard, free internet, good shower. You couldn't open a window so the air con had to be on. Underground parking was available at approx $12 per night. There was a 'White Spot' restaurant which is a chain like Dennys or Wendys located in the lobby which we found handy for breakfast. We also went to Caffe Artigiano on W.Hastings St between Howe and Granville for breakfast which was very good. The hotel offered a free downtown shuttle service but we walked and it took approx 10-15 minutes. Ours was a short stay but this Best Western had everything we needed to make it an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at a great price”
Reviews.Author: VLM
Reviews.Content: After deciding on a quick two day end of summer get away to Vancouver, the next task was finding a hotel to stay. Based on the reviews found at Trip Advisor, we decided on the Best Western Down Town Vancouver. Important to us was location & price. This hotel was in the perfect location - a short walk to BC Place, Yaletown, Granville Island and Robson St. And given the downtown location during high season - a pretty good price (AAA discount). A block away from the hotel, we were able to see fantastic live music at the Yale. There was a bit of confusion with our reservation - the reservation clerk booked us for 2 rooms for one night instead of 1 room for 2 nights which was quickly rectified upon check-in. As described in other reviews, the bed was extremely comfortable with a big fluffy duvet. The fridge & microwave were great for re-heating leftovers from dinner. Complimentary shuttle service, bottled water and umbrella were a nice touch. Best of all was the service received from the front desk clerk - Phillip. Welcoming small talk, efficient service, clear explanation of the services provided during our stay and very impressive - he remembered me and the reason for my trip when he came back on shift the following evening. We are planning a return visit in October for a Commodore show and will definitely be booking back into this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BIG ROOMS/COMFY BEDS/GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: JudyK
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 people in a room after being on cruise. They let us check in before noontime which was great! BIG rooms, nice private bathroom. Great location to walk down to take little boat over to Granville Island. Staff VERY helpful with info about the area!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bit far out”
Reviews.Author: NDMartin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July for 3 nights at the start of a month of travelling down the Pacific Coast. The hotel was great, very clean and nice rooms, free wifi, fitness centre and laundry for guests. The staff were very friendly and there was a good shuttle service that took us to the train station after we had checked out. The only downside to this hotel was its location is quite far away from the main attractions of downtown Vancouver, it was at least half an hours walk to Canada Place and Stanley Park, though the shuttle bus would take you assuming you have booked in advance, otherwise be prepared to wait for it. For the price we paid it was a nice hotel in a reasonable location if you don't mind walking.

Reviews.Title: “Ok location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spudyagain
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice - good big room, big beds etc. Standard Best Western. It is quite centrally located on Granville however it is at the somewhat 'dodgy' end where I wouldn't like to walk around solo at night. We had no problems as a group though. Free shuttle to the waterfront (or a 25 min walk). Staff were helpful enough but gave confusing information. Asked about transport to the airport and were told there were only taxis. Next day we asked the same person who told us the aeroporter shuttle stopped right outside the door. Which it did, 30 min to airport. But quite confusing nevertheless...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel..Very Friendly and Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Jeero22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and were VERY pleased. The room was quiet, and well-appointed. Very nice bath, bright and clean. Great TV reception, and nice light in the room. The bed was EXCELLENT (I slept like a baby!) We'll stay here again. This hotel is a class act!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sometravel_81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western at Granville/Drake based on strong positive TripAdvisor recommendations, which were certainly met. The location, although it seemed initially slightly dicey, was actually within 5 minutes walking distance from Robson Street, and just across the bridge from Granville Island. The rooms were large, spacious and clean. Service was generally excellent, with extremely quick check-in. The free shuttle service throughout downtown Vancouver was also an added bonus. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: eledean
Reviews.Content: After reading various reviews, I decided to stay at the Best Western Downtown while visiting my daughter in Vancouver. After one night, I knew it was the wrong place for me. The room was tiny although clean with nice amenities. The noise from the street was terrible in spite of the fact that I had a sleep machine running. I like a dark room to sleep in, and light streamed through the edges of the curtains. Worst of all, the neighborhood made me uncomfortable, not dangerous but panhandlers and homeless people on the street corners. I have never been uncomfortable walking in downtown Vancouver, but I did in this area. I was also very disappointed that there was no complimentary breakfast, only an overpriced, average restaurant attached to the hotel. Considering all the good places to eat in Vancouver, you don't want to waste your money at the White Spot Restaurant. We checked out as soon as possible and moved to the Hampton Inn, which is where we should have stayed from the beginning. On the positive side, the front desk staff and cleaning staff were very nice, and the free internet worked flawlessly. It's certainly not a bad hotel, but it just wasn't the place for me.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, Inexpensive, Clean, Walkable to downtown Vancouver + Shuttle Bus!”
Reviews.Author: Bookman54
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few days prior to an Alaska cruise with extended family. Easy stroll to Robson Street area and to Yaletown. Shuttle bus gets you to cruise piers. Clean accessible room, lacks wheelchair roll-in shower. Front desk quite helpful with directions and range of recommendations; taxi company literally down the street so little wait. WiFi connection was fine in room. Met our needs and saved a bundle.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice for the $”
Reviews.Author: cheyenps
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. Beds comfy, rooms clean and attractive, staff sharp and helpful. WiFi hooked right up and there was no additional charge. I'll stay there again any time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget choice for Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: simplebloke7
Reviews.Content: I got the prevailing deal (Expedia in my case). As previously stated here, the hotel is fine, with clean rooms of reasonable size and a good standard of cleanliness. I aimed "cheap" because I was travelling solo, but I would be perfectly happy to bring my family here. The thing which made me decide to write this review was the standard of advice about Vancouver and skiing available at the front desk. The staff gave unstinting and (as it turned out) accurate advice on Vancouver's attractions. One small comment - the hotel is on the southern edge of downtown, and the neighbourhood is not upmarket. However, as already mentioned, I never felt uncomfortable and would happily bring my family to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: Dagger_TO
Reviews.Content: Not much more to add to the already positive reviews. Good price. Walking distance to good restaurants. Convenient location to go to UBC. There was road construction occuring which wasn't a pretty sight but it did not interefere accessing the hotel nor did it cause a noisy environment. During checkin the desk clerk seemed disinterested and not too happy. However that will not dissuade me from returning.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice...”
Reviews.Author: Kundara
Reviews.Content: This place was pretty "fancy" for a Best Western or what I was used to. The rooms were nice and very clean, although a little on the small side. The views from our rooms were very nice also but it was a little bit of a walk from the actual downtown were all the shops and people were. This hotel's location is isolated compared to the more central region of downtown Vancouver. The front desk and staff in general were very accomodating and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: happyboredom
Reviews.Content: Maybe not an ideal location for families because everywhere you want to go is at least 3 blocks away. For mobile adults it's a short walk to the interesting things in town. If you don't want to walk they have a free shuttle (I didn't need it). They have free wi-fi but it's slow. The parking in the basement is convenient and costs about $15 CDN.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Bubs404
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Downtown is a great casual stay for the money. We have booked here a few times and always had a clean, well appointed room with no hassles. I would recommend this hotel if you want a no-frills, clean & stress-free stay. Location is relatively central as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, will be staying there on my next trip”
Reviews.Author: wozza46
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Downtown Vancouver for a couple of nights in May 08, and was very impressed. The hotel is modern, comfortable, and clean. The hotel staff were helpful and welcoming. It's in a good downtown location at a reasonable price. While there's not much directly around the hotel, it's a short walk to Robson St, and close to Granville Island. Perhaps my only problem was with the chain restaurant attached to the hotel, where the staff were rude and the service was slow (waiting over an hour for breakfast is just not acceptable). But if you avoid them you should have a good stay. I highly recommend this hotel if you are visiting Vancouver and want something close to the city centre. I am planing a trip to there next year and intend to go back to the Best Western Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wrigleys
Reviews.Content: The Best Western in Downtown is really a good deal! We stayed there 2 nights and it was fabulous. The hotel itsself is definitely great. Wonderful view from the roof, while you work out in the fitnessroom, play table-tennis or relax in the jacuzzi. The rooms are really nice, large and clean and absolutely calm (really amazing)! Beds are comfortable. The area is not as bad as it is sometimes described here. It is not unsafer than the rest of Vancouver! There always people on Grainville Street (This is the ''worst'' street), the 7eleven is open 24hours and there is a police station, just 50m down Grainville Street from the hotel. So it should be fine! A lot of other hotels are on Grainville Street by the way (Ramada, another BW, Holiday Inn Suites is in the street next to Grainville Street,...) The bad parts of Vancouver are Surrey and definitely Hastings Street, which is between Gastown and Chinatown. Just get sure you don't walk around there in the dark! But these parts are far away from this Best Western! I can really recommand this hotel, but only 4 of 5 stars, cause parking is not for free and there is no breakfast included!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recomend!”
Reviews.Author: melindalrahe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situation in the heart of downtown Vancouver. At first we were afraid the room was going to be too small, when we saw the hotel, but it truly wasn't. The room is furnished with solid oak, not cheap pressboard furniture, which makes it feel like you're at a nice place. There were extra touches, like a sign that said they have toiletries in the lobby, hot water cooker, iron/board, coffee maker with premium coffee. It surpassed our expectations, especially for the price. It was very clean. The front desk personnel were very professional, like persons who have a hospitality degree (very atypical for 3 or 4 star American hotels). If we ever visit Vancouver again, we won't even search for hotels, we will just stay here again. I was impressed, and it felt like a 4 star hotel. Note that Vancouver is a very liberal city - typical for a large city, and that is what you will see if you walk the streets outside the hotel. I wouldn't call the walk 'kid-friendly'. Lots of goth clubs, several 'peep' shows, etc. However, there are allot of nice street-side cafes. We enjoyed the Greek restaurant nearby (can't remember the name), and the Crepe cafe. We purchased a SmartPass and enjoyed many local attractions. This hotel is well located for location attractions (museums, aquarium, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Really good”
Reviews.Author: Essellanden
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. While it's not really in the Downtown area (it's a on the south end), everything we needed (breakfast, supermarket, dinner) was withing walking distance. The parking garage took a little getting used to. Not all floors connected to the elevators, there were steps and small staircases on P1 and P2, so if you have heavy suitcases, park at P3. Front desk staff ware friendly and efficient. We arrived early (around noon), but they had a room ready so we could check in. The room was very nice and clean; the beds were quite high (but very comfortable) and all equipment was in good working order. We found out there were complimentary bicycles availiable, so we took those and explored downtown, gastown and Stanley Park. All in all we had a hassle-free, relaxed stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Findley15
Reviews.Content: After our Alaska cruise we stayed at the Best Western Downtown Hotel in Vancouver. It was an inexpensive and convenient choice for our two-day visit. The staff was most helpful and accomodating by suggesting bus and walking tours. We arrived from our cruise ship at 8:00 am, and our luggage was stored while we walked to the water taxi and visited the markets on Granville Island. The room was clean and comfortable. rosegarden

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, location not so great”
Reviews.Author: aussie_rose64
Reviews.Content: hubby and i stayed for two nights in this hotel and were very happy with our room. we didn't really have a view to speak as we were on one of the low floors of but the accommodation was very clean and well looked after. we found the area a bit 'iffy' though we were told it was quite safe to walk around at night. some homeless people asking for money was the main problem. the room itself was a bit on the small side but very clean and modern. bed was most comfortable. there was only two of us so the size of the room was not to much of a hassle. front desk staff were very friendly and nothing was to much trouble. can't comment on parking as we had no car and used public transport. we would have no trouble recommending this hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel, 2 star neighbourhood, 1 star elevator”
Reviews.Author: Ase78
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good, everything clean and it's got a good central location. It's close to yaletown (very nice restaurants etc). However there are lot's of homeless people outside (not that i felt unsafe) that could make a first night impression of BC feel less impressed. There is no breakfast included however there is a whitespot in the building for a nice breakfast. The elevator is very very slow and might give you an extra 10 minutes wait to get downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, rude staff...”
Reviews.Author: ragjunk
Reviews.Content: Location: 4 stars - Very convenient and walkable to most downtown attractions. Even Stanley Park is about 30 minutes by walk. There are a few adult entertainment facilities on Granville St, but we walked around 10PM and felt safe. Facility: 4 stars - New facility, clean room, although smaller. We stayed in 2 double bed rooms. The underground parking space is a little scary and doesn't give an impression that this hotel is decent. Parking is $10+tax a day, which is not that bad, even though free parking would have been nice. Staff: 1 star - The staff ruined the fun out of staying in this facility, which is a nice place otherwise. Our reservation, made from a AAA office, indicated that 4 adults will be in the room but without even looking at the details, the staff started saying that the price quoted is for 2 adults and so on. The same thing was repeated when I confirmed about the kitchenette. The reservation indicated that the room would have a kitchenette and again, the staff said they will charge extra. But, after verifying the reservation details, the staff agreed that it was part of the reservation. The same drama was repeated when we checked out. By then, they should have known how many were in the room and the fact that the credit card authorization was already taken. All looked very cheap to me. Miscellaneous: There is no complimentary breakfast. You will get a room facing Drake St and overlooking a liquor store, if it is not one of the deluxe rooms. This is not a bad thing, but just beware of the views you will be getting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: TucsonTraveller2
Reviews.Content: What a great staff. Upon arrival, we were greeted by the hotel manager, which is quite a novel idea. At check-in, we had a problem with our reservation; we reserved a room with 2 beds but were given a king bed. They corrected the problem within minutes even though being fully booked. The room was quite comfortable; it looked as though it had been renovated recently. The staff answered all my questions regarding eateries and attactions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Diana846
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel at a reasonable price. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms, although a little small, were clean and very comfortable. The White Spot Cafe had quality food for a decent price. We enjoyed our stay and will stay in this hotel again when we return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely worth it”
Reviews.Author: Danler
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms. Staff willing to go the extra mile--they bent over backwards to ensure that my partner could print a document from her computer--very impressive. Free internet. Free local calls. Complimentary bottled water. Fridge in room, and microwave. Everything clean--and to drive it home, WHITE bedspreads. And a great finish: No surprise charges on the bill. I think these people asked themselves "what do customers hate?" and they eliminated everything we don't like. Friends stayed at a much more expensive hotel and they were "nickel and dimed" to death. Not at the Best Western. We had concerns originally about the safety of the area--no problem! I ran into ONE panhandler. And when I said "no", it was no problem. There is construction going on next door, and we could see the work from our tenth floor room, but it never disturbed our sleep. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Convenient and good service”
Reviews.Author: rock2fox
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and great employees. This property is convenient to everything, in spite of it being across downtown from the harbor (only a 10 minute walk). We got in a day early and the only room they had was the penthouse. They gave it to us for a slight difference in price ($179.00) and let us stay in the PH on our second night (the original reservation) for price of the lesser room. Awesome location, everything is 10 minutes walking distance or less. BEWARE the senior citizen cruiseship crowd, there was a 10 minute wait for one of the two elevators on Saturday b/c a cruise ship was departing and many of the would-be golden year sailors had sequestered themselves at this inexpensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here this summer”
Reviews.Author: RVV
Reviews.Content: Fine hotel. Clean and spacious room. Nicely located (though the presence of doubtful individuals give Granville Street a weird atmosphere later at night), close to downtown points of interest. Despite the (in general) positive impression of this hotel, I wouldn't recommend staying here this summer. There's is a construction site right next to the hotel, causing significant disturbance. It woke us up at 7 am on weekdays. Mid May, they were still demolishing the existing building. So they'll probably be doing demolishing and construction work the entire summer. Beware of that before booking (I wish I would've been...). The hotel staff did apologize after I complained about this, but that was all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: tacomarick
Reviews.Content: We stopped over in Vancouver on our way to Whistler. What a great Stay. Some of the reviews refer to the neighborhood and while it is on the edge of downtown, Vancouver is a huge diverse city and I have never felt unsafe walking around and this area was no different. The room had a very comfortable bed and a large fridge which was nice. Good water pressure in the shower. An in room safe, coffee pot, microwave,etc. The ammities include a roof top terrace with a great view that has a recreation area that includes a hot tub with a view, a ping pong table, and excercise machines. The staff was very friendly and the hotel also had secured underground parking for only 10.00 which is a bargain for hotels these days. We used the hotel in room guide book for a reccomnedation on dinner and were not dissapointed. And we got a 25% discount on dinner with our room key! A great little local restaruant called Characters. They had Indian and greek cuisine. Overall a wonderful stay. The hotel also has a White Spot restaurant in the hotel which had great service.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable & affordable”
Reviews.Author: cpyoon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel that's very clean, modern, excellent / convenient location and affordable. Location may look sketchy but it's safe. It's just in an older part of downtown. Besides the resturant at the hotel, you'll need to walk to find more and definately drive a bit before really getting to the heart of downtown but it's all pretty close. Room was good and clean. Bed was very comfortable. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Affordable & Clean!”
Reviews.Author: travelbugOttawa_On
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of reviews here at TripAdvisor, I settled on Best Western Downtown Vancouver primarily because of it central location. We only had a limited number of days (3) in Vancouver and we wanted to be able to hop on a bus or walk to most major attractions. While it is true that there are some adult shops along Granville Rd we hardly passed through it since we mostly walked along Howe St and Seymour St. The hotel was close to a 7 Eleven store for convenience item needs. The hotel itself was super clean. The pillows and duvet were fluffier than more expensive hotels I've stayed in. The housekeeping staff were excellent! We always came back to crisp, clean room after a day of sightseeing. There was even a day were we walked from the Waterfront station (Seabus/Skytrain) and it only took us 20mins even with young children in tow. Their exericse room had enough amenities to satisfy a basic fitness buff. The room also offered a wonderful view of downtown's building and False Creek.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: jazzywazzy
Reviews.Content: Location This is an affordable alternative for staying right downtown a few blocks from Robson St and walkably close to Davie St. as well. If you like to walk, downtown Vancouver is perfect because I walked all the way from the waterfront back to the hotel and it took about a half hour. Everything in the downtown area is pretty close to the hotel. I even walked back from Stanley Park and that was doable! I wouldn't recommend walking that distance with children though. Also if you go up to the roof of the hotel, you can get a pretty nice view of the downtown. There's a rooftop patio. Service The hotel is kept very clean and although my room was small, it had everything I needed. If you want quiet, ask for a room on the back of the building. I think this type of request is called a "quiet room" request. Every day you can request one free 30 minute internet card per room to use the internet in the lobby which was nice. Just ask at the front desk, and in case you're wondering, ther's no printer. There's a free shuttle to take you anywhere downtown which is convenient, we used that shuttle one day to get to Stanley Park. Be Wary A few things to watch out for: the people you talk to at Best Western if you call are not actually in Vancouver so the information they gave my friends and I was not accurate. We were told there was a free airport shuttle to bring us back to the airport and that was false, we were told a few other things that actually weren't true once we spoke to the front desk. Another thing to warn you about: SOME CAB DRIVERS ARE DISHONEST. We had to take a van to cab from the airport to the hotel and once we got there the driver told us it was an extra $10 because we took a van. If you find yourself in this situation, do not pay that extra fee, it's a scam and completely untrue. There's actually a little hand out among all the pamphlets at the hotel that has the Taxi Code of Conduct which outlines all the standard rules and guidelines about taxi services in Vancouver. All in all, my friends and I had a nice stay at the Best Western Downtown Vancouver, we recommend it :o)

Reviews.Title: “good hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: habsrule12
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location for what we were ther for. We were there to just relax for a long weekend and sight see on Granville. We walked a lot that weekend and it was nice that our hotel was at the end of the busiest street. We only had to walk a part block and we were right in the middle of everything going on downtown from shops to strip clubs.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Moe68
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on my own for three nights and had a great time, finding the location very convenient and also my single room to be quite clean. There's a White Spot restaurant right next door that's probably one of the better places to eat in the area, but if you don't mind walking or eating something simpler, there's a lot of pubs and fast food (esp. pizza) type places all along Granville Street too. The Sky Train station was about a 20 minute walk away and that might be a bit much for a family with very young kids, but other than that no worries about the location. There is however a complimentary drop-off only car service from the hotel that runs from 7am-7pm each day that will take you closer to downtown if you like. Coming from the airport, the Airporter shuttle bus dropped me off right at the hotel ($21/ return), so for a little more than 10 bucks each way I saved a big part of the $30 or more that a single cab ride would likely have cost. It will pick you up from nearby as well for your return home. Great hotel and I'd definitely stay there again. By the way, there is another Best Western a few blocks further north on Granville if you'd rather not walk as far to get downtown. Just another tip: If you're wanting to go to Whistler for skiing like I did, take the Greyhound bus from the main bus station. It's a hell of a lot cheaper (about $42/ return) than some of the other bus services you might see advertised, and stops right at the resort village.

Reviews.Title: “Naughty but nice”
Reviews.Author: WeWantAnotherHoliday
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is rather seedy and not at all inviting, but beyond that the hotel itself was excellent. The rooms were very comfortable and contained everything you may need, including plush pillows and duvet for a good nights sleep, safety deposit box, microwave, fridge, tea/coffee making facilities, television and clock radio, telephone, haridryer and even an umbrella! The staff were very friendly and helpful especially in the White Spot Restaurant situated next door, which offered excellent food at affordable prices. The hotel offered an internet connection service in the lobby and provided a free shuttlebus service during working hours, dropping you at any location within the Downtown Vancouver area. There was also a 7-11 grocery store just opposite the hotel - open 24 hours which offered a good selection of groceries. Vancouver itself is a lovely city, we would highly recommend you visit Stanley Park, Capilano Suspension Bridge and Grouse Mountain. Oh! and if you have the time and wheels, why not take the ferry across to Vancouver Island to visit Butchart Gardens and Victoria, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “extremely unorganized and terrible service”
Reviews.Author: anon30
Reviews.Content: Tons of errors and mistakes were made, and it all started even before we stepped into this hotel for our stay (you'll know what I mean later). First, we tried booking the "taste of yaletown" package online....nothing worked, so we decided to phone the hotel and book it directly over the phone. When we arrived there for our stay, they told us they could not find our reservation!! Luckily we've got our confirmation no. with us, and they finally was able to find the record and give us a room. The package included breakfast and free parking, both of which were not given to us until we asked for it and had to explain abt the package listed on their website (shouldn't they know better what they've put up on their own webpage??). Internet connection in room was extremely bad...next to nil (aren't I glad I wasn't there for a businness trip!). Next, we asked for their complimentary downtown drop-off shuttle to robson st. (mind you, it's only single way...so u gotta find your own way to get back to the hotel)...and when we asked for it, we had to put up with an unfriendly comment sounded with an attitude: "oh, just so u know, robson st. is actually within walking distance " (OMG....duh!!!). I was so glad and relieved to leave this hotel the next day, thought it ended there? NO....we later found out that they charged us twice for that one night stay...how did it happen?? Guess what, they booked us for the wrong date right from the beginning (after we've confirmed the date we wanted at least twice during the booking on the phone )...so they ended up charging us a "no-show" for the wrong date + the night we actually wanted and have stayed. When we were disputing this with their staff, one of their front desk server was giving me an attitude even before I started getting mad at them!! Is this how you deal with your customers? It was definitely the MOST TERRIBLE hotel experience I've ever had in my entire life! oh, and btw, good luck with trying to email them...I had a simple, straight-forward question that probably would've taken a few sec for them to ans...I've received no reply or any acknowledgement after a week now....and counting... I have reason to believe that they're selectively ignoring emails, what a great way of treating customers!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: estragon
Reviews.Content: I have only one complaint about the Best Western Downtown Vancouver. More about that below, but first, the good -- and there's lots of it. We were checked in quickly by friendly and efficient front-desk staff. My colleague and I were assigned rooms in the same location on different floors. We both had trouble accessing the (free) wireless internet, so the next day the hotel cheerfully moved each of us to another room on the same floor. The first room I was in was set up for business travellers, with one queen-sized bed; a cordless phone by the bed; and a desk set up for working travellers, with a phone and a conveniently located electrical outlet built into the desk. Unfortunately, that was the room that was in a wireless dead spot. The second room was bigger, with two beds and a kitchenette, but no business amenities. The bathroom in each room was clean and quite adequate. The quality of the towels reflects the budget rates (about $100 a night). There is no business centre at the hotel, but the front desk staff were very helpful and gracious about printing documents for me and doing some photocopying. There is underground parking, and also a free shuttle that guests can use to get away from the somewhat seedy immediate surroundings. And now, for my one major complaint: the only breakfast available in the immediate vicinity of the hotel is at the White Spot that adjoins the hotel. White Spot is a popular western-Canadian chain that serves an awful breakfast -- everything on the menu is bland, greasy and heavy, and there are absolutely no palatable light options. We put up with it on four of the seven days we were there, and each time the food sat in my stomach like a rock. We didn't find any other breakfast spots for blocks around... until our last day. Just on the other side of the bridge, at 2211 Grenville, is a great place called Paul's Place Omelettery. It's open from 7 a.m., service is quick and cheerful, and the food is way tastier and healthier. It's a little less than a mile away -- a two-minute drive, or a 15-minute walk across the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: mnmn926
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here for 1 night prior to our cruise from Ballantyne Pier. The hotel was very clean and well kept. It is right on Granville Street which has numerous restaurants, shops etc. in case you need something prior to your cruise. Our room was small but extremely clean with a great view of downtown. The rooftop sitting areas are a very nice added attraction. The hotel was about a $10 CAD ride from the Amtrak station and about $15 CAD from Ballantyne. They offered a shuttle but we decided to just ride alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: LePiaf
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderfull stay at the Best Western Downtown Vancouver. We requested an early check in when we booked and were told it would be noted, but they could not guarantee it. When we arrived at 1 AM, there was no problem at all. Our room was already available and we could enjoy the rest of the afternoon in Stanley park, without worrying about our luggage. The complimentary shuttlebus took us everywhere we wanted to go (one way). Just call the reception on the day you want to make use of it and they plan it in. It's easy to walk wherever you want, but the Granville part is a bit dodgy for the first three blocks. That's why the shuttle is such a great service! We liked our Queen cornerroom. It wasn't very big, but it was sufficient and very clean. We left a tip for the maid and she left us a thank you note in return. There was a nice showercurtain in the bathroom, with a see through part so the light goes through and you can look into the bathroom while showering. Apart from the complimentray coffee and tea, the kettle for boiling water was a nice touch, opposed to making hot water through the coffeemaker (which always leaves my tea tasting like coffee). We also liked the free bottle of water in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Best Western”
Reviews.Author: katianaMontgomery_AL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights prior to an Alaskan cruise. I chose this hotel because it was convenient to the downtown area. We were very pleased with everything about this hotel from the front desk personnel to the room to the free shuttle to the pier. The room was very large and more than adequate for our stay. The front desk was very helpful with any questions that we had about the city. We did not realize when we booked this hotel that they had a free shuttle to the pier so we were very surprised and pleased when we checked in and found this out. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to or coming from a cruise or just visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: saharaomeara
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights beofre travelling back to Ireland and had a wonderful time. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a penthouse suite by a lovely front of house manager. The staff were extremely helpful and the location of the hotel was wonderful, Granville St is full of character and I liked the way it wasn't super touristy. The street may be a tiny bit run down but I always felt very safe - even as a woman walking on my own late at night. I would glady stay in the this hotel again as it was superb value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, comfortable -- iffy neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: adls
Reviews.Content: I'm originally from Vancouver, and even now I come back once every 1-2 years for a break from work. Vancouver really does deserve its reputation as one of the best places on earth to live. And even if I'm not a typical tourist going to all the typical tourist spots - I still love to come back, relax and wander around town. It's a perfect place just to chill out, and laze about - basically heaven for a slacker mall-rat like myself looking for some quiet down-time away from work. My wife and I previously stayed at many hotels of all price ranges in all parts of Vancouver - but our previous favorite was the Meridien at 910 Beach. In many ways, that was an ideal place for us. Modern, clean rooms with every imaginable amenity for a couple or small family: fully equipped kitchen, laundry, spacious living rooms etc. It is perfectly appropriate to call it a home away from home if you're thinking about a week-long break (like we usually do). We particularly like their townhouse suites - which are outside the hotel 'proper' and even more like staying in your own home. It suits me more in that I feel more like a local Vancouverite and less like a tourist. The reason that we didn't stay there this time was because the Meridien does NOT have air conditioning. Yes, I know Vancouver is not known to be a warm city, but did anybody notice the temperatures here in early July this year rising to over 35 Celsius?! That's Global Warming for you all, folks. Sorry I'm not greener myself - but I do appreciate some air-con in this kind of weather. That's why we looked elsewhere. Our key requirements were: air-con, secure parking, convenient location, cleanliness, and preferably Internet access. I use the Internet when travelling with a small laptop to access all the wonderful online travel guides - so I never need to bring travel books and maps. And I use the hard-drive to store my digital photos. Oh yes, this time we were also travelling with our baby son -- so we definitely needed a kitchen or kitchenette. We needed this so we could clean our son's milk bottles out daily, and prepare pureed food for him. In this regard, the Meridien would have been ideal - but alas, no air-con ... After some internet browsing, we shortlisted a few choices - but the good rate on Expedia clinched it for the Best Western Downtown in our case. We were attracted by the free parking and WiFi access - and the apparently very modern-looking building. We stayed for exactly one week in a King-size bedroom with kitchenette, and made use of the free secured basement carpark. So how was our stay? Let's break it down into categories: 1. ROOMS Great room. Large, comfortable and very clean. This hotel looks and feels modern and new - and I prefer that to quaint, old hotels. The room was large enough that we could open both our large suitcases and park our baby stroller - and still have lots and lots of room to walk around. The carpets, sheets, curatins etc all looked spotless. The kitchen and bathroom were well stocked, and we appreciated the generous supply of towels - even though there was no bathrobe. The bed was huge and generally comfortable - though personally, I would have preferred it to be slightly firmer. The aircon control was a bit confusing (not helped by the really hopeless printed instructions), but once we got the hang of it, it worked flawlessly -- it was quiet and could raise or lower the room temperature quite quickly. Sound-proofing was good. No only did we not hear our neighbors at all, but we felt comfortable that our baby's occasional cry did not disturb anyone either (and that's important, as all parents know). One big tip: do NOT accept a room on the 2nd floor: a sort of wall blocks off all views out of the windows on this floor. We ended up with a 7th floor room facing north. Okay, the views aren't great (tall buildings, traffic), but at least we got some light coming in and making the room fell more airy. 2. AMENITIES There was a top-floor gym & jacuzzi apparently, but we didn't use it this time. We didn't try the restaurant, but as it was just a White Spot (a famous local chain of nice family restuaurants) - as Vancouver 'regulars', we knew exactly what we would have gotten anyway: a reasonably priced, decent family food in a casual friendly setting. Because there is no other actual hotel restaurant, there is no complimentary breakfast here - but hotel breakfasts are not something my wife and I really care for anyway. However, we did make full use of the underground parking. There was ample parking space, and it was great that the elevators could go straight from your room's floor to your car's floor. It was reassuring that the elevators required your room key to access any floor except the lobby - good security. Like many hotel carparks in Vancouver, this one was clean and well-lit. Because we had our own car, we didn't use the shuttle bus that apparently would take you to any part of downtown (which was within walking diatnce anyway). But we did see other hotel guests using it and they seemed pleased with the service. As I mentioned above, I use the WiFi Internet access on my travels. The one at this hotel worked OK - except for a couple of days in the middle of my stay when connection was impossible for some reason. Then a couple of days later, it was back to normal again - strange. We appreciated that a full-sized umbrella was provided in each room (necesary if you know what Pacific Northwest weather is like). There are vending machines on a couple of the floors - which seems ubiquitous in North American hotels these days. And if that's not enough, there's a 7-Eleven across the street. 3. SERVICE The service was OK. One or two of the front desk staff (the male ones) seemed a little aloof, but everyone else was warm and friendly. Check-in was quick and efficient. Liam - one of the young porters - was especially cheerful and helpful, even when it was apparent we would not be tipping hm twice ! When we asked for a baby bed, the staff were again helpful. They had a crib/playpen which they brought up very quickly on our asking. It wasn't quite what we were looking for, and Liam was quick to take it away and bring back a fold-away bed for us to try. This was meant for big kids, not babies - so again it was unsuitable, and again Liam was prompt and cheerful when whisking that away. In the end, we slept with our baby on our bed (it was certainly more than big enough) - and the staff seemed genuinely apologetic that they didn't have exactly what we wanted. 4. LOCATION I noticed quite a few other reviewers commented on the location being a bit dodgy. Let's make it absolutely clear: this is NOT a good neighborhood. The 3-4 blocks on Granville St just north of Granville Bridge is basically the red-light district. You have cheap bars, a few XXX shops, some dubious pawn shops, and a shady-looking liqour store right next door to the hotel. At night, you see a few pan-handlers or one or two prostitutes at the street corner. Of the 7 nights we stayed there, on 2 of those nights, we drove back to find a police car responding to call outs at the next door liqour store. When we told our Vancouver friends where we were staying, their eyes bulged out on hearing "Granville on Drake" - they knew how rough that part of town is. However, having said all this, this is still NOT the worst part of town. I would say the Hastings St area just north of Chinatown is at least many times worse than this - and I would seriously, seriously warn any tourists (not only single females) to avoid that area at all times. This is the area where mobs of drug addicts and distinctly mean-looking ruffians lurk. Compared to that part of Hastings, the area around the Best Western Downtown is really quite tame. In fact, we were not troubled at all during our stay. Much of that has to do with our driving everywhere. Because we went straight in and out of the underground parking every day, we basically never had to face anything at street level. And in our room, the sounds from the street simply didn't reach us. With that in mind, the location of the Best Western Downtown is really not bad at all. It is on the south side of the Downtown/West End peninsula, and this provides the best center (in my opinion) for accessing the whole of Greater Vancouver. Driving to Richmond, Burnaby, Coquitlam and so on was simple. Downtown and Chinatown are only minutes away by car. Getting to Stanley Park and North/West Van is also a doddle: from the hotel travel up Seymour, turn left onto Georgia - and that's it. Very convenient. I've stayed at some of the hotels nearer Stanley Park, and the locations of those are not as good. From that end of town, if you want to reach any other part of Vancouver, basically you have to face the notorious traffic jams on Georgia every single time. On the south side of the peninsula (like the Best Western or even the Meridien), you only have to struggle with the Georgia jams when you go to cross the Lion Gate Bridge. 5. WOULD I STAY HERE AGAIN? The Best Western Downtown gave me more or less everything I required. Free secure parking, good air-con system, fully stocked kitchen, free Internet access, clean modern rooms, very convenient location (if driving). Given a good deal , I would not hesitate to recommend this place to a friend or even stay here again myself. But if I were inclined to walk more and drive less, or if the Meridien decided to install some air-con - maybe I would have to think again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and base for sight seeing.”
Reviews.Author: PontypriddMick64
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel at the end of June. A very good base and location for sight seeing. As the hotel is close to the Trolley bus stop, on the edge of the city and Granville Island market. The city is quite small and can be walked in around a day, as it is. The facilities at the hotel were adequate, with a sizeable bathroom, tea/coffee maker, tv (with wide choice of channels). Staff very helpful , though not exactly warm in their welcome. The restaurant next door, did do a good breakfast though. Good value for money, which filled me for most of the day! I would recommend this hotel ideal for couples and singles. Would probably stay there again, if visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for downtown”
Reviews.Author: canada_rocks1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon so they did upgrade us to the penthouse floor and our room was supposed to have a jacuzzi bath. However, it didn't work and even though I reported it no one came to mend it. We did have a balcony though which nice to look out over the Vancouver sky line and we were on the same floor as the gym and communal jacuzzi which was very handy. It didn't have its own restaurant but there was a White spot downstairs which we thought was great value for money. Its only about a ten minute walk to the shops but there is a bus stop on the opposite of the road in front of the 7 Eleven which was handy for visiting down town one way and Granville Island the other.

Reviews.Title: “great location, but not the greatest stay”
Reviews.Author: dakine77
Reviews.Content: room was very cramped and not very modern, although clean. the air conditioning did not seem to work and there were no windows that could be opened. the location is great, right in downtown. the thing that turned us off was the service. front desk staff was very stoic and not very helpful. overall, just an average stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Rahwayan
Reviews.Content: Hotel is an excellent choice. Very clean and bright rooms with full amenities. Quiet area. Easy walking distance to all points (and bus stops nearby). This neighborhood, despite other reviewers' comments, is not at all scary and with the pace of construction in Vancouver, is improving rapidly. We have stayed at more expensive, fancier hotels and this one beats them all. Really great value.
